name: Aan'allein
info: What the Aiel call [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran). The name means “One Man,” or “He who is an entire people.” This obviously refers to Lan's being the last surviving Malkieri.

name: Abell Cauthon
info: [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s father. He is excellent with a bow and arrow, and is in general a really nice guy; Mat does not know of anyone who does not like him. He has five children: Matrim, [Bodewhin](#Bodewhin-Bode-Cauthon), and [Eldrin](#Eldrin-Cauthon), ages 20, 17, and 16, respectively, and two other daughters. His wife is [Natti](#Natti-Cauthon).

name: Adan
chapter: Chapter 25: The Road to the Spear
info: [Lewin](#Lewin)'s greatfather. He appears in steps four, five, and six of [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s viewings. Adan was not only the grandfather of the man who headed the group that broke from the Aiel to form what are now called the Aiel, but also was the leader of the Aiel when some of them decided their path was incorrect and split off to form a new band of people that did not serve the Aes Sedai, instead carrying their own possessions in the wagons. These people are now called the Tuatha'an, the Traveling People, and are the only people in the world that still follow the Way of the Leaf.

name: Adelin
info: Maiden of the Spear who comes back from scouting to tell [Rhuarc](#Rhuarc) about the trouble at Imre Stand that they found. She is of the Jindo sept of the Taardad Aiel.

name: Adine Lewin
info: [Flann](#Flann-Lewin)'s wife. She is plump, with a “self-contented” eye.

name: Adora Aybara
info: [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara)'s eldest sister. She is sixteen, or about four years younger than Perrin.

name: Aedomon
info: Man who led the Saferi down on unsuspecting Manetheren years ago.

name: Aeldra
info: Woman the man [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) sees in _Tel'aran'rhiod_ is looking for. Since he was only dreaming and entered the World of Dreams by accident, she was not there for him.

name: Aemon al Caar al Thorin
info: King of Manetheren during the Trolloc Wars. He died trying to save his city, and the city died shortly thereafter. The site of this battle was called Aemon's Field, which is where the present-day city of Emond's Field is located. Aemon's last names still exist in Emond's Field: the al'Caars and the al'Thors still live there.

name: Aginor
info: One of the Forsaken. He was the second one to be released from the sealing on the Bore. He was trapped close to the surface of the Bore, so he was not shielded from the passing of time very effectively; he emerged as a _very_ old man, so old that his face was so wrinkled one could barely make out his features anymore. He was killed by [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) at the Eye of the World.

name: Ailys Candwin
info: Woman from Emond's Field. She keeps a “neat” (tidy) house beyond the Winespring Water.

name: Ala
info: Ogier, mother of [Damelle](#Damelle), daughter of [Soferra](#Soferra).

name: Alanna Mosvani
info: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah. She has long, black hair, dark eyes, and is dark and slender. She has several Warders, including [Ihvon](#Ihvon) and (until recently) [Owein](#Owein). She thinks that [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara), and [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) should be bonded as Warders to “keep an eye on them,” but _says_, “I am not so lost to custom yet as to bond a man against his will. Not quite yet.” She is shameless around men.

name: Aldieb
info: [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred)'s white mare.

name: Alijha
chapter: Chapter 25: The Road to the Spear
info: An Aielman who is with [Lewin](#Lewin) in [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s fourth step through the columns of Rhuidean. He is nearly identical in appearance to [Charlin](#Charlin).

name: Alnora
info: A woman who [Jonai](#Jonai) wishes were alive to interpret dreams and possibly predict which action he should take. She had glossy black hair.

name: Alric
chapter: Chapter 47: The Truth of a Viewing
info: Warder bonded to [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche) for almost twenty years (i.e., almost since she was raised to the shawl).

name: Alsbet Luhhan
info: Wife of [Haral](#Haral-Luhhan). She is almost as large as her husband, which is quite large.

name: Alsera
chapter: Chapter 48: An Offer RefusedChapter 49: Cold Rocks Hold
info: Wife of [Bruan](#Bruan).

name: Alviarin Freidhen
info: Aes Sedai of the White Ajah. She is one of the people [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) confides in, at least a little—this surprising, given the general hatred of White sisters by those of the Red Ajah. Alviarin is described as “swan-necked,” with a very calm, cool demeanor.

name: Alwhin
info: Sharp-faced, blue-eyed Seanchan woman with a “perpetual glower.” The left side of her head is shaven, the other side long and brown-haired. She is a _sul'dam_, and has been raised to a Voice of the Blood. No other _sul'dam_ has ever been raised to the Blood before, much less to a Voice of the Blood, but Alwhin knows too much to be a simple _sul'dam_: she knows that _sul'dam_ can be controlled via _a'dam_. She was intended to hold [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara)'s leash when the Seanchan attempted to collar her outside the Ways with [Liandrin](#Liandrin)'s assistance.

name: Amathera Aelfdene Casmir Lounault
info: King [Andric](#Andric)'s choice for the next Panarch of Tarabon. She shares his bed, but is not supported by the Assembly.

name: Amico Nagoyin
info: Aes Sedai of the Black Ajah. She was stilled during capture after the taking of the Stone of Tear. She retains none of the cool self-possession that her co-captor [Joiya](#Joiya-Byir) possesses. She was the youngest of the Black sisters who left the Tower with [Liandrin](#Liandrin), barely old enough to wear the shawl.

name: Amyrlin Seat
info: Leader of the Aes Sedai. She is appointed for life by the Hall of the Tower, whose decision must be unanimous. Once appointed and installed, the Amyrlin Seat is said to be “of all Ajahs and none,” regardless of which Ajah she was raised from, although this is often overlooked in the history and politics of the Tower. The post is currently held by [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche), formerly of the Blue Ajah. She is the youngest person to ever hold the office; she gained it when she was only thirty years old.

name: Amys
info: Wise One of the Nine Valleys sept of the Taardad Aiel ([Aviendha](#Aviendha)'s clan and sept). She meets [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) in _Tel'aran'rhiod_ and tells her to come to her for training, and sends for [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred) to come to Rhuidean. Amys is wife to [Rhuarc](#Rhuarc), and sister-wife to [Lian](#Lian) (Rhuarc's other wife). She is also mother-sister to Aviendha. She can channel.

name: Anaiya
chapter: Chapter 47: The Truth of a Viewing
info: Aes Sedai of the Blue Ajah. She was very interested in [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere)'s ability to Dream. She is described as “motherly.”

name: Ananda
info: Aes Sedai of the Yellow Ajah. She is slender, and has black hair to her waist. [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw) has a viewing of her indicating that she will die on the same day as many other Aes Sedai and Warders are killed or injured.

name: Andric
info: King of Tarabon. He asks [Carridin](#Jaichim-Carridin) for help from the Children to restore order in the city of Tanchico. He is a graying man, and wears a lion mask for his meeting with Carridin.

name: Anla
info: [Elsbet](#Elsbet)'s sister. She served as her advisor, and there is even a separate story that [Thom](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin) is fond of telling that is all about her: “Anla the Wise Councilor.”

name: Aram
info: [Raen](#Raen) and [Ila](#Ila)'s grandson. He met [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara) and [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) when they were leaving Emond's Field for the first time.

name: Arent
info: [Loial](#Loial)'s father.

name: Artur Hawkwing
info: Name by which [Artur Paendrag Tanreall](#Artur-Hawkwing) was known during and after his conquest of the world.

name: Asmodean
info: One of the Forsaken. He was a musician before he turned to the Shadow; he did so in order to obtain revenge on those who were more successful musicians than he. [Lanfear](#Lanfear) says that he would be able to teach [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) how to control _saidin_ and that he would not be as anxious to kill him as the other Forsaken would be.

name: Asne Zeramene
info: Aes Sedai of the Black Ajah with dark, tilted eyes and a bold nose. She grew up in Saldaea. She was of the Green Ajah (openly, at least) before leaving with [Liandrin](#Liandrin); she regrets leaving her Warders behind when she left the Tower.

name: Astelle al'Seen
info: Oldest of the al'Seen family. She uses her cane to thump people who are in her way more often than to walk with.

name: Athan Dearn
info: A fat man from Emond's Field.

name: Avendesora
info: The Tree of Life of Legend. It is the last surviving Chora tree, and is located in Rhuidean. A cutling of the Tree was given to the people of Cairhien as a sign of goodwill from the Aiel. That Tree, _[Avendoraldera](#Avendoraldera)_, grew in the center of the city of Cairhien until [King Laman](#King-Laman-Damodred) cut it down to make a throne out of the wood. Laman's Sin (as it is now called) brought four Aiel clans over the Spine of the World to kill Laman for killing the Tree.

name: Avendoraldera
info: Tree grown in Cairhien from a cutling from _[Avendesora](#Avendesora)_, the legendary Tree of Life. It was a gift for the Cairhienin from the Aiel over 500 years ago.

name: Aviendha
info: Aiel of the Nine Valleys sept of the Taardad Aiel. She is _Far Dareis Mai_, a Maiden of the Spear. She is good friends with [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere), [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand), and [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara), whom she met when Nynaeve saved her spear-sister during their search for [He Who Comes With the Dawn](#He-Who-Comes-With-the-Dawn). She is also friends with [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor), although since he is a man she believes him to be as bad as all the rest of them.

name: Ba'alzamon
info: Ancient name from the Trolloc Tongue, believed to be the Trolloc name for the [Dark One](#Dark-One). It means “Heart of the Dark,” in the Old Tongue. Ba'alzamon claims to have sent the Trollocs during the Trolloc Wars for over three hundred years, told [Artur Hawkwing](#Artur-Hawkwing) to send armies across the Aryth Ocean, and told the same Hawkwing to refuse the Aes Sedai Healing that could have saved his life and proclaim with his last breath that Tar Valon must fall.

name: Bael
chapter: Chapter 48: An Offer RefusedChapter 49: Cold Rocks Hold
info: Clan chief of the Goshien Aiel. He is the tallest man [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) has ever seen, a full hand taller than either himself or [Rhuarc](#Rhuarc). He has a booming, low voice.

name: Bain
info: Maiden of the Spear of the Black Rock sept of the Shaarad Aiel. She is first-sister to [Chiad](#Chiad); they had to sneak through the other's camp to meet the Wise Ones and become first-sisters, since their clans were (and are) in blood feud. The two of them get along well with [Faile](#Faile-Bashere). Bain has short, fiery hair that is slightly darker than Chiad's.

name: Bair
info: Aiel Wise One of the Haido sept of the Shaarad Aiel. She is a Dreamwalker, and one of [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere)'s teachers.

name: Balthamel
info: One of the Forsaken. He was the first of the Forsaken to be released from the sealing on the Bore. He was trapped very close to the surface of the Bore, and thus not shielded very effectively from the passage of time; he emerged so deformed by age that he had to hide his face behind a cloth and was unable to speak. He was killed by the [Green Man](#Someshta) at the Eye of the World.

name: Bandry (Ban) Lewin
info: Young man from Emond's Field.

name: Bandry (Ban) al'Seen
chapter: Chapter 33: A New Weave in the Pattern
info: Wil's cousin, [Jac](#Jac-al-Seen)'s son. He got all of the nose in his family.

name: Bayle Domon
info: Ship captain and smuggler from Illian. His ship was captured by [Captain Egeanin](#Captain-Egeanin) at Falme, and she was afraid Domon would recognize her. She was right—he did.

name: Be'lal
info: One of the Forsaken. He was killed by [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred) in the Stone of Tear, just before [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) took _Callandor_. Since he was destroyed by balefire, he is completely dead—not even the [Dark One](#Dark-One) himself can bring him back.

name: Beidomon
info: Male Aes Sedai who assisted [Mierin](#Mierin-Eronaile) in tapping the new source of Power that she had discovered. It is not known whether the two knew that they were actually boring into the [Dark One](#Dark-One)'s prison, but all evidence seems to indicate that they did not.

name: Bela
chapter: Chapter 47: The Truth of a Viewing
info: Horse that [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) rode from Emond's Field to Tar Valon. [Siuan](#Siuan-Sanche) uses Bela to carry her to Amadicia. Bela was [Tam al'Thor](#Tamlin-Tam-al-Thor)'s farm horse before the Trollocs came on Winternight.

name: Berelain sur Paendrag Paeron
info: The First of Mayene. She surprises [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) in the night right before the first “bubble of evil” comes. She also tries to hit on [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara). Strangely enough, the only man she seems to ignore completely is [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), who is the one person that might react to her advances. [Faile](#Faile-Bashere) hates her, mainly because she goes after Perrin. Her sign is a hawk.

name: Berin Thane
info: Brother of [Jon Thane](#Jon-Thane), the miller in Emond's Field.

name: Bethamin Zeami
info: A _sul'dam_ who was left behind after the battle at Falme, now captured by [Captain Egeanin](#Captain-Egeanin). When Egeanin found her, she tried to get away, so Egeanin snapped the _a'dam_ she was carrying around her neck, hoping to use it as one more barrier to the woman fleeing (since Bethamin supposedly cannot channel, the _a'dam_ should have no other effect than throwing a metal ring around her head). Much to Egeanin's and Bethamin's surprise, the _a'dam_ held Bethamin just as well as it held the _damane_ it was intended for. From this, and from [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara)'s and [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand)'s information about the possibility of learning to channel (not just having it inborn), Egeanin reasoned that all _sul'dam_, including Bethamin, could channel if they were taught—which went against everything she had been taught her entire life.

name: Bili Congar
info: An old man from Emond's Field. [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara) thinks that even old Bili would be better at knowing the right thing to do than he was, even if Bili was full of ale.

name: Bili al'Dai
chapter: Chapter 33: A New Weave in the Pattern
info: Oldest of the people who join [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara) on his strike to free the Emond's Fielders who are being held prisoner by the Children of the Light (except for [Tam](#Tamlin-Tam-al-Thor) and [Abell](#Abell-Cauthon)).

name: Bili
info: Character from a children's tale, _Bili Under the Hill_. The book involves three wishes, and reminds [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) of the twisted doorway leading to the world of the Aelfinn.

name: Birgitte
info: Hero of Legend called back by the Horn of Valere. She is an archer who uses a silver bow and arrows with which she never misses. She is always linked to [Gaidal Cain](#Gaidal-Cain) in the stories. [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) thinks she saw Birgitte in the Aiel Waste of _Tel'aran'rhiod_. She also stops [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara) from entering the Tower of Ghenjei in his Wolf Dream. She is just as beautiful as the stories say she was.

name: Bodewhin (Bode) Cauthon
info: [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s sister, now seventeen. She and her sisters used to tell on Mat all the time when he was up to his usual mischief.

name: Bonwhin Meraighdin
chapter: Chapter 47: The Truth of a Viewing
info: [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat) before the War of the Hundred Years, during the reign of [Artur Hawkwing](#Artur-Hawkwing). She was stilled for trying to make Hawkwing a puppet of the White Tower, nearly breaking the Tower in the process. She was Red Ajah before being raised to the Amyrlin Seat, only the second Red raised since the Trolloc Wars, and was the last Amyrlin from that Ajah until now. The other Red raised was also deposed and stilled. [Siuan](#Siuan-Sanche) knows that Bonwhin was the last person to be kept in the cell she and [Leane](#Leane-Sharif) are thrown into.

name: Bors
info: Name that [Jaichim Carridin](#Jaichim-Carridin) is called by [Liandrin](#Liandrin). He first used the name at the conference with [Ishamael](#Ishamael), where he was given his orders to kill [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor).

name: Brandelwyn (Bran) al'Vere
info: Mayor of Emond's Field and owner of the Winespring Inn. He is [Marin](#Marin-al-Vere)'s husband and [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere)'s father. As mayor, he heads the Village Council, and has to deal with the Wisdom should it be necessary to deal with the Women's Circle.

name: Bruan
chapter: Chapter 48: An Offer RefusedChapter 49: Cold Rocks Hold
info: Clan chief of the Nakai Aiel.

name: Buel Dowtry
info: Fletcher of Emond's Field. He makes even better arrows than [Tam al'Thor](#Tamlin-Tam-al-Thor), and insists upon doing all the fletching for the city by himself, until [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara) convinces him that it is unneccessary.

name: Buiryn
info: King of Manetheren when [Aedomon](#Aedomon) attacked. He met Aedomon's charge at Midean's Ford, the subject of a song that [Jasin Natael](#Jasin-Natael) sings to the Aiel. Due to the memories of other men's lives [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) gained from the Eelfinn, he remembers that the story was not as perfect as it is now told.

name: Captain Egeanin
info: Dark-haired Seanchan ship captain. She hires [Floran Gelb](#Floran-Gelb) to recover _a'dam_ for her, as well as look for other _sul'dam_ that fled Falme.

name: Car'a'carn
chapter: Chapter 34: He Who Comes With The Dawn
info: _Car'a'carn_, p. 552 (498)—According to the Prophecy of Rhuidean, the man destined to unite the clans of the Aiel. The term means “Chief of Chiefs” in the Old Tongue.

name: Careen
info: Aiel woman. She whispered to [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred) that the Wise Ones needed to see her.

name: Carlin Aybara
info: [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara)'s uncle. He died a while back.

name: Cenn Buie
info: Thatcher in Emond's Field. He sits on the Village Council, and is quick to point fingers at people who are accused by someone of doing something wrong. He cooperates with the Whitecloaks.

name: Cerindra
info: Woman in Tanchico who supposedly claims to have all kinds of gossip about [Amathera](#Amathera-Aelfdene-Casmir-Lounault).

name: Charendin
chapter: Chapter 25: The Road to the Spear
info: Man who challenges [Mandein](#Mandein) (in a way) and asks if the one who comes _will_ come when the Stone that Never Falls actually does fall.

name: Charlin
chapter: Chapter 25: The Road to the Spear
info: An Aielman who is with [Lewin](#Lewin) in [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s fourth step through the columns of Rhuidean. He is nearly identical in appearance to [Alijha](#Alijha).

name: Charn
info: [Coumin](#Coumin)'s greatfather during [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s eighth step through the columns of Rhuidean. Everyone thinks he is crazy because he tells of a time when [Lanfear](#Lanfear) was not evil. He actually was one of her servants when she was an Aes Sedai, and was intrigued by the “new source of the One Power” that [Mierin](#Mierin-Eronaile) (i.e., Lanfear) had discovered, until he found out that that source was the [Dark One](#Dark-One)'s prison.

name: Chenda
info: Roofmistress of Maindo Cut when [Bair](#Bair) was a girl.

name: Chesmal Emry
info: Aes Sedai of the Black Ajah. She left the White Tower with [Liandrin](#Liandrin). She is one of three Black sisters that [Amico](#Amico-Nagoyin) knew of before leaving the Tower.

name: Chiad
info: A Maiden of the Spear, of the Stones River sept of the Goshien Aiel. She is first-sister to [Bain](#Bain); they had to sneak through the other's camp to meet the Wise Ones and become first-sisters, since their clans were (and are) in blood feud. The two of them get along well with [Faile](#Faile-Bashere). Chiad's hair is slightly blonder than Bain's.

name: Chief Librarian
info: Tairen who locked away nine different translations of the Prophecies of the [Dragon](#The-Dragon) in a chest in Tear. He gave them all to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor), and he read them all (except the one in the Old Tongue).

name: Chion
info: The _gai'shain_ who escorts [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) to bed in Cold Rocks Hold. She is killed by a Dragkhar during the attack on the Hold, as was [Seana](#Seana).

name: Cilia Cole
info: Pink-cheeked, big-eyed girl from Emond's Field. She was [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara)'s first kiss.

name: Coedelin
info: Wise One who supervised [Amys](#Amys)'s training as a Wise One.

name: Coine din Jubai Wild Winds
info: Sailmistress of _Wavedancer_, the Sea Folk vessel that [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) and [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) take from Tear to Tanchico. She is [Jorin](#Jorin-din-Jubai-White-Wing)'s sister.

name: Colinda
chapter: Chapter 28: To the Tower of Ghenjei
info: Wise One of Hot Springs Hold. She tells [Gaul](#Gaul) that he thinks too much for a Stone Dog.

name: Colline
chapter: Chapter 25: The Road to the Spear
info: [Charlin](#Charlin)'s and [Alijha](#Alijha)'s sister.

name: Colly Garren
info: One of [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara)'s recruits. He was killed by the Trollocs when they attacked the patrol from behind.

name: Comran
chapter: Chapter 25: The Road to the Spear
info: [Mandein](#Mandein)'s greatfather. He was the one who found Ogier _stedding_ in the Dragonwall and commenced trade with them.

name: Con Aybara
info: [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara)'s father. He laughed in [Ordeith](#Ordeith)'s face when he said Perrin was a Darkfriend. Ordeith killed him and his family by burning their house down with them inside it.

name: Coramoor
info: According to the Jendai Prophecy of the Atha'an Miere, the man who will take the Sea Folk from the sea. Since these prophecies are almost identical in most parts to the Prophecies of the [Dragon](#The-Dragon), it is likely that [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor) is the Coramoor as well.

name: Corianin Nedeal
info: The last Dreamer in the White Tower; an Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah. She died 473 years ago. All of the _ter'angreal_ that [Liandrin](#Liandrin) and her Black sisters stole were previously studied by Corianin, as was [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere)'s twisted stone ring.

name: Corin Ayellin
info: Woman from Emond's Field who [Cenn Buie](#Cenn-Buie) did some bad roofwork for. She sits on the Women's Circle.

name: Couladin
info: Aiel of the Shaido clan who accompanies his clan to Rhuidean while [Muradin](#Muradin) is there testing become the next chief of the Shaido Aiel. He says he will go in if Muradin fails, but the Wise Ones refuse him permission.

name: Coulin
info: Warder who is in charge of [Galad](#Galadedrid-Galad-Damodred)'s and [Gawyn](#Gawyn-Trakand)'s training in the White Tower.

name: Coumin
info: [Jonai](#Jonai)'s father. He is hiding in the city during [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s seventh step through the columns of Rhuidean. Coumin broke the Covenant by taking up arms against those attacking the city.

name: Dael al'Taron
info: One of [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara)'s recruits. He was killed by the Trollocs when they attacked the patrol from behind.

name: Dag Coplin
info: One of the Coplins who went with [Lord Luc](#Lord-Luc-Chiendelna) and [Wit Congar](#Wit-Congar) to tell the Whitecloaks that Emond's Field was closed to them.

name: Dain Bornhald
info: Son of [Geofram Bornhald](#Geofram-Bornhald). He commands the army of Whitecloaks that are stationed at Watch Hill in the Two Rivers. He is determined to find [Perrin Aybara](#Perrin-Aybara), the man who he believes led his father to his death (he also thinks Perrin is a Darkfriend). Dain has a hatred for those who killed his father, and like most of the Whitecloaks he is convinced that it was Aes Sedai who beat them at Falme (i.e., the Seanchan are just a story engineered by Darkfriends to hide their actions). He vows to avenge his father's death.

name: Daise Congar
info: [Wit](#Wit-Congar)'s wife, and Wisdom of Emond's Field after [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara)'s disappearance. She is almost as big as [Alsbet Luhhan](#Alsbet-Luhhan), and even harder to stand up to.

name: Damelle
info: Ogier, daughter of [Ala](#Ala) daughter of [Soferra](#Soferra). In a book [Loial](#Loial) once read, she wrote of the the first Waygate to be destroyed—it was near a _stedding_ that had fallen to the Blight. It required 13 Aes Sedai working together using a _sa'angreal_. She also wrote of a later attempt to distroy a Waygate of similar circumstances using only nine sisters, an attempt that ended in disaster for the Aes Sedai.

name: Danelle
chapter: Chapter 47: The Truth of a Viewing
info: Young Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah who is in charge of watching [Master Jovarin](#Master-Jovarin)'s masons and seeing to their money supply. She is one of [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan)'s supporters, one of the sisters who arrested [Siuan](#Siuan-Sanche).

name: Dannil Lewin
chapter: Chapter 33: A New Weave in the Pattern
info: [Flann](#Flann-Lewin)'s nephew, and [Tell](#Tell-Lewin)'s cousin. He and Tell look so much like Flann that they could be sons (or even clones) instead of nephews. [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara) knows him by smell.

name: Dara
info: Girl that [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) flirts with on occasion. She is a servant in the Stone of Tear.

name: Dark One
info: Name, used in every land, for [Shai'tan](#Dark-One).

name: Darl Coplin
info: [Hari](#Hari-Coplin)'s brother. He also likes to run to the Whitecloaks with tales. Their entire family is likely to join up with whoever they think is strongest and stand by them, even if they hate them.

name: Darvan
info: One of the men allegedly vying for [Elmindreda](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw)'s hand in marriage. Darvan does not exist; the two suitors idea was put into place to give Min an excuse to be in the Tower.

name: Daughter of the Night
info: Literal translation of the Old Tongue “Lanfear,” adopted as a name by one of the Forsaken.

name: Daughter of the Nine Moons
chapter: Chapter 14: Customs of MayeneChapter 15: Into the Doorway
info: Woman who [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) is destined to marry, according to the people in the twisted doorway world (the Aelfinn). They also tell [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) that he will die and live another life, part of  “what was,” and that he will “give up half the light of the world to save the world.”

name: Dav Ayellin
info: Young man, about [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor), [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), and [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara)'s age, from Emond's Field. He is stockier than Mat, but has the same look in his dark eyes. He was as mischevious as Mat, too.

name: Davian
info: False [Dragon](#The-Dragon) of old times. [Ba'alzamon](#Ba-alzamon) claims that he was used by Aes Sedai, just as all other false Dragons were.

name: Davram t'Ghaline Bashere
info: Lord of Bashere, Tyr, and Sidonia; Guardian of the Blightborder; Defender of the Heartland; Marshal-General to [Queen Tenobia](#Queen-Tenobia-si-Bashere-Kazadi) of Saldaea; and her uncle. He is [Faile](#Faile-Bashere)'s father. Faile (or, as her parents named her, [Zarine](#Zarine-Bashere)) did not tell [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara) who her father really was at first, because she was afraid he would not understand.

name: Dealda ni Carridin
info: Youngest sister of [Jaichim Carridin](#Jaichim-Carridin). She was carried from her bridal feast by a Myrddraal. Carridin hopes she died quickly, as he has heard that women do not cling to sanity long in the hands of a Fade.

name: Deindre
info: Aes Sedai from [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s seventh step through the columns of Rhuidean who was at the meeting where the Aes Sedai discussed the final fate of _Callandor_ and the Dragon Banner. She had a Foretelling concerning future meetings.

name: Demandred
chapter: Chapter 57: A Breaking in the Three-fold Land
info: One of the Forsaken. He would kill [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) before teaching him, according to [Lanfear](#Lanfear). Lanfear also said that he turned to the Shadow out of envy for [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon).

name: Dermon
chapter: Chapter 25: The Road to the Spear
info: Tall, white-haired man of the Jenn Aiel. He is a spokesman for the Jenn.

name: Deselle Aybara
info: [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara)'s middle sister. She is twelve.

name: Dhearic
chapter: Chapter 48: An Offer RefusedChapter 49: Cold Rocks Hold
info: Clan chief of the Reyn Aiel.

name: Dorele
info: Servant on board _Wavedancer_. She is reprimanded for not wearing a shirt when the ship is within sight of land.

name: Dorindha
info: A Maiden of the Spear with red hair; she is about [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere)'s age. She gives [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) a smile on his way by—she was one of the ones who convinced him to play a game of Maidens' Kiss. She has red hair.

name: Dragon Reborn
info: According to the _Karaethon Cycle_, the Prophecies of the Dragon, the man who is the Rebirth of [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon), the man known as the [Dragon](#The-Dragon) during the War of the Shadow. Over the years, many men have claimed to be the Dragon Reborn, even men who could not channel. The true [Dragon](#The-Dragon) has been Reborn in a young man named [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor), a shepherd from Emond's Field.

name: Ealsin Aybara
info: [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara)'s great-aunt. She never got married.

name: Eban Vandes
info: Man who wrote _The History of the Stone of Tear_, a book [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) read while in his room in the Stone. It told him of the twisted doorway which led to the world of the Aelfinn, the people who answer three questions.

name: Edelle Gaelin
info: Wisdom of Watch Hill. She and the Women's Circle plan to meet “[Lord Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara)” and make sure he's right for the Two Rivers. She is good at making dried-apple tarts.

name: Egwene al'Vere
info: A young woman from Emond's Field, now one of the Accepted. She has considerable potential with the One Power, and will most likely be one of the strongest Aes Sedai in over a thousand years. It is also thought that she may be the first Dreamer in the Tower in almost 500 years. Egwene is good friends with [Elayne Trakand](#Elayne-Trakand), the Daughter-Heir of Andor, and is also a childhood friend of [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor), the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn). In fact, Rand and Egwene were all but Promised in their youth, but both of them feels an almost sibling-like love for each other now; they know that they cannot get married, and do not really want to (though they have yet to reveal these sentiments to each other). Egwene is the love interest of both of Elayne's brothers, [Galad](#Galadedrid-Galad-Damodred) and [Gawyn](#Gawyn-Trakand)—she is flattered by Galad's attentions, but she does not return them; she does find Gawyn to her liking, however. Egwene, along with Elayne and [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) is one of the only people [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche) trusts in the Tower; Siuan is convinced through their actions to date that they cannot possibly be Darkfriends. She sent them on a dangerous mission: spring the obvious trap the Black Ajah had set for them, and see if they can catch them in the process. Egwene is currently in the Stone of Tear, following the aftermath of the battle with [Be'lal](#Be-lal) and the taking of the Stone.

name: Elaida do Avriny a'Roihan
info: Aes Sedai of the Red Ajah. She is one of the most powerful of the Aes Sedai. She served as advisor to [Queen Morgase of Andor](#Morgase-Trakand), a position she sought after she had a Foretelling about the importance of the Royal Family of Andor. Elaida is the only Aes Sedai alive to have any real strength in the Fortelling—the last Aes Sedai to actually have regular Foretellings was [Gitara Moroso](#Gitara-Moroso), now dead over twenty years. Elaida keeps her own agenda, and is very suspicious (as all Reds are) of Blue Ajah activities, especially those of [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred) and [Siuan](#Siuan-Sanche) (Elaida still considers the Amyrlin to be of the Blue Ajah, not of  “all Ajahs and none”). Elaida's Foretelling about the importance of the Andoran Royal Family occurred during the Third War of Andoran Succession, after which Morgase took the throne.

name: Elam Dowtry
info: Man from Emond's Field who comes with [Dav](#Dav-Ayellin) to help [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara). He is also Perrin's age.

name: Elayne Trakand
info: The Daughter-Heir of Andor, the only daughter of [Queen Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) and her late husband [Taringail Damodred](#Lord-Taringail-Damodred). She is sister to [Gawyn](#Gawyn-Trakand) and half-sister to [Galad](#Galadedrid-Galad-Damodred). Elayne is now one of the Accepted, and has considerable potential in the One Power; she may become stronger than any living Aes Sedai save her two friends, [Egwene al'Vere](#Egwene-al-Vere) and [Nynaeve al'Meara](#Nynaeve-al-Meara). Elayne, along with Egwene and Nynaeve, is one of the only people [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche) trusts in the Tower; Siuan is convinced through their actions to date that they cannot possibly be Darkfriends. She did not, however, send Elayne on the mission she gave the other two so as not to anger Morgase any more than she already had. Elayne still chose, of her own volition, to accompany her friends on their dangerous mission: spring the obvious trap the Black Ajah had set for them, and see if they can catch them in the process. Elayne is currently in the Stone of Tear, following the aftermath of the battle with [Be'lal](#Be-lal) and the taking of the Stone. Her sign is a golden lily.

name: Eldrin Cauthon
info: [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s sister. She is sixteen. She and her sister [Bode](#Bodewhin-Bode-Cauthon) were always anxious to tell on Mat when he was up to mischief.

name: Eldrith Jhondar
info: Plump Aes Sedai of the Black Ajah. She was of the Brown Ajah to the rest of the Tower until she left with [Liandrin](#Liandrin). She hates cats—things might get complicated if [Marillin Gemalphin](#Marillin-Gemalphin) finds out Eldrith has been killing the stray cats she has been adopting.

name: Elisa al'Seen
info: [Jac](#Jac-al-Seen)'s wife.

name: Elmindreda (Min) Farshaw
info: A young woman from Baerlon. She gives her full name to [Faolain](#Faolain-Orande) in hopes that the [Amyrlin](#Amyrlin-Seat) will be the only one to recognize it and know who she is—the name is actually out of a story, and the character who her mother took it from spent most of her time sighing at men. It is also the name Min assumes while in the Tower to make certain people do not learn her true identity. Min has a special ability that few besides herself know about: she sees images and auras around people, especially around Aes Sedai and Warders, that Foretell their futures. Min does not always know what these viewings mean, but when she does, it _will_ happen; it is only a question of how and when. Min was fascinated by the number of images she saw around [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor), especially the one she saw that included herself: three different women are destined to fall in love with him, one of which is herself.

name: Elsbet
info: A woman who was allegedly the Queen of the entire world in the Age before the Age of Legends, according to one of [Thom](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin)'s gleeman tales. Thom doubts she was queen of anything more than a very strong nation.

name: Else Grinwell
info: A former novice in the White Tower. She was dismissed because she spent most of her time admiring the Warders and their trainees in the practice yard instead of studying. [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) and [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) stayed at her father's farm while enroute to Caemlyn (from Shadar Logoth).

name: Elwin
info: [Adan](#Adan)'s son. He died of hunger at age ten.

name: Elyas Machera
chapter: Chapter 28: To the Tower of Ghenjei
info: Man that [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara) met right after leaving home. Elyas was a Warder at one time, and left the Tower when he discoverd that he could talk to wolves. He didn't find any problem with the ability by itself, but felt the need to get away from the Red Ajah, who thought they should gentle him (even though there was nothing to be gentled) because of his ability. Elyas helped Perrin learn that he could talk to wolves as well; Perrin does not necessarily like the ability, but has gotten over the dislike of it as well.

name: Eran
info: [Faile](#Faile-Bashere)'s footman, a member of her father's first command. He taught her to fight with knives and with her bare hands. She thinks he did so for the amusement value.

name: Erim
chapter: Chapter 48: An Offer RefusedChapter 49: Cold Rocks Hold
info: Clan chief of the Chareen Aiel.

name: Esole
info: Son of [Jonai](#Jonai). He died of the Wasting Sickness that eventually kills all men who can channel.

name: Eurian Romavni
info: Kandoran author of the book _A Journey to Tarabon_, which he wrote 53 years before [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) read it.

name: Ewal Coplin
info: One of the Coplins who went with [Lord Luc](#Lord-Luc-Chiendelna) and [Wit Congar](#Wit-Congar) to tell the Whitecloaks that Emond's Field was closed to them.

name: Eward Aybara
info: [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara)'s uncle, [Con](#Con-Aybara)'s brother.

name: Eward Candwin
info: Cooper of Emond's Field. _He is named Edward the first time his name is mentioned, but future references are to Eward._

name: Eward Congar
info: Citizen of Emond's Field who “fawns” over the Whitecloaks. Like many members of his family, Eward tends to take the side of whoever he thinks is strongest, regardless of their agenda.

name: Ewin Finngar
info: Young man from Emond's Field with a resonant bass voice. The last time [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara) saw him, he was a stout, squeaky nuisance who tried to crowd in when the bigger boys got together. Now he is on a pace to be as big as Perrin.

name: Faelar
info: Misspelling of [Laefar](#Laefar). _This mistake is fixed in the paperback edition._

name: Faile Bashere
info: Name that [Zarine Bashere](#Zarine-Bashere) of Saldaea assumed when she became a Hunter of the Horn. She has long dark hair and dark eyes. While on her quest to hunt for the Horn, she encountered [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred), [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran), and [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara) when they were persuing [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) to Tear. She was shocked to find out that the Horn of Valere had already been _used_, much less found, and even more surprised that Rand was the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn). When she found this information out, Moiraine forbade her to leave them, since if she did she could upset the balance of the world by telling the wrong person that the [Dragon](#The-Dragon) was Reborn. Faile eventually developed feelings for Perrin, feelings which he found he returned.

name: Faolain Orande
info: One of the Accepted. She has dark curly hair and dark skin. She meets [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw) when she comes to the White Tower to give [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred)'s message to the [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat). She has a dislike for wilders.

name: Farran
info: Whitecloak officer who sends [Ivon](#Ivon) to tell [Dain](#Dain-Bornhald) about [Ordeith](#Ordeith) and the Tuatha'an. He is a “bearded boulder of a man yet light on his feet.”

name: Father of Lies
info: Alternative name for the [Dark One](#Dark-One).

name: Father of Storms
info: Name that the Atha'an Miere, the Sea Folk, use for the [Dark One](#Dark-One).

name: Flann Lewin
info: Farmer from the Two Rivers whose farm was attacked by Trollocs. His family and he are staying with [Jac al'Seen](#Jac-al-Seen).

name: Floran Gelb
info: Man who recovers things for [Captain Egeanin](#Captain-Egeanin). He also jumps [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) for her, thinking she is one of the _sul'dam_ Egeanin meant to find.

name: Gaidal Cain
info: Hero of Legend, one of those called back by the Horn of Valere. He is always linked to [Birgitte](#Birgitte) in the stories. Unlike her, Cain is not nearly as beautiful as he is said to be in the stories. [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) thinks that he must be the ugliest man she has ever met in her life—his face is wide and flat, his heavy nose too big, his gash of a mouth too broad.

name: Galadedrid (Galad) Damodred
info: Half-brother to [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) and [Gawyn](#Gawyn-Trakand). He has a massive crush on [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere), but although she is flattered and embarrased, she does not return his affection. Her real affection is for his half-brother Gawyn. Galad is virtuous to the point of fault (in Elayne's eyes, at least)—he will do whatever he thinks is right, regardless of who is hurt by his actions, including himself or his friends. He is strikingly handsome, and even Aes Sedai sit and watch him for hours while he practices the sword for the sole reason of looking at him.

name: Garam
chapter: Chapter 25: The Road to the Spear
info: Aielman in the lead of the men with lances [Rhodric](#Rhodric) encounters. He is part of the vision [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) sees in the second step through the columns of Rhuidean.

name: Gaul
info: Aiel of the Imran sept of the Shaarad Aiel. He is _Shae'en M'taal_, a Stone Dog. [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara) rescued him from his entrapment in Remen—he was captured by “wetlanders” while searching for [He Who Comes With the Dawn](#He-Who-Comes-With-the-Dawn). He is one of the Aiel who guards [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s quarters in the Stone of Tear. He was the leader of the Stone Dogs who came to the Stone. He has green eyes and long eyelashes.

name: Gawyn Trakand
info: Son of [Queen Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) of Andor, brother of [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) and half-brother of [Galad](#Galadedrid-Galad-Damodred). He will become First Prince of the Sword when his sister becomes Queen. He is in Tar Valon training with the Warders, as all sons of Andoran queens must do. Gawyn has feelings for [Egwene al'Vere](#Egwene-al-Vere), and she returns them, but he refuses to even express his interests since Galad has a crush on Egwene as well. His sign is a white boar.

name: Gearan
chapter: Chapter 25: The Road to the Spear
info: Lanky Aielman who comes with [Lewin](#Lewin) in [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s fourth step through the columns of Rhuidean. He was the best runner among the wagons.

name: Geofram Bornhald
info: Late captain of a large army of Children of the Light. He was killed at Falme in the Seanchan attack. He was one of two people who knew that [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara) killed Whitecloak officers.

name: Get Eldin
info: Bald-headed farmer who [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara) stations near [Master Luhhan](#Haral-Luhhan)'s forge to keep people from bothering him while he works.

name: Ghoetam
info: Man who once sat under _[Avendesora](#Avendesora)_ for forty years in order to gain wisdom. [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) did not believe the stories until he himself sat there.

name: Gitara Moroso
info: Aes Sedai of the Blue Ajah, now dead twenty years. She was very strong in the Foretelling, and served as advisor to the Queen of Andor until being appointed [Keeper of the Chronicles](#Keeper-of-the-Chronicles). Her last Foretelling was perhaps her strongest, and occured in front of [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche) and [Moiraine Damodred](#Moiraine-Damodred), then Accepted almost ready to be raised to the shawl—this Foretelling was to announce the birth of the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn).

name: Goemal
info: One of the men allegedly vying for [Elmindreda](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw)'s hand in marriage. Goemal does not exist; the two suitors idea was put into place to give Min an excuse to be in the Tower.

name: Gomanes
info: One of two Whitecloaks killed in a skirmish with Trollocs. [Dain](#Dain-Bornhald) thinks it more than coincidence that [Joelin](#Joelin) and Gomanes were the only ones killed; he had sent the two of them to make certain [Ordeith](#Ordeith) was not creating havoc.

name: Graendal
info: One of the Forsaken. She “collects” handsome young men.

name: Grassburner
info: Alternative name for the [Dark One](#Dark-One).

name: Gray Fox
info: Name that [Thom Merrilin](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin) was known by once upon a time.

name: Guaire Amalasan
info: False Dragon of centuries past, from Free Years 939–943. He started the War of the Second [Dragon](#The-Dragon), during which a young king named [Artur Paendrag Tanreall](#Artur-Hawkwing) rose to overwhelming prominence and power. [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche) recommends gentling [Mazrim Taim](#Mazrim-Taim) to avoid another episode like that when Amalasan was being gentled.

name: Gyldin
info: A servant in the manor where sisters of the Black Ajah are staying at in Tanchico.

name: Had al'Lora
info: Boy who [Jaim Aybara](#Jaim-Aybara) is anxious to tell that [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara) called him cousin.

name: Had
info: Young man from Emond's Field who died in the Trolloc attack.

name: Hadnan Kadere
info: Peddler who runs into [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor), [Rhuarc](#Rhuarc), and the rest of their party in the Waste. Rhuarc tells Kadere that he was fortunate to meet them, for had they continued on, they would have reached Rhuidean—if they had done so, Kadere and all of his party would most likely have been executed.

name: Haindar
info: Man who will arrive at the meeting between the Aes Sedai during [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s seventh step through the columns of Rhuidean. It is presumed he was able to channel, and will assist them in keeping the two items safe from men who can channel in the future (until the [Dragon](#The-Dragon) is Reborn). One of the Aes Sedai present points out that there can be no mistakes since he and [Jaric](#Jaric-Mondoran) are due to arrive the next day.

name: Halan
info: [Loial](#Loial)'s grandfather, [Arent](#Arent)'s father.

name: Halvar
info: The First of Mayene around 300 years ago. He gave the Tairens the twisted doorway _ter'angreal_ that leads to the land of the Aelfinn as a sign of goodwill. He was betrayed by the High Lords only a few years later.

name: Hammar
info: A Blademaster and Warder. He teaches the sword in the White Tower. [Gawyn](#Gawyn-Trakand) holds him in very high esteem.

name: Han
chapter: Chapter 48: An Offer RefusedChapter 49: Cold Rocks Hold
info: Clan chief of the Tomanelle Aiel. Short and stocky, at least for an Aiel—in the Two Rivers, he would be taller than the average man. He has very white hair.

name: Haral Luhhan
info: Blacksmith of Emond's Field. [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara) was his apprentice before he left home. He told Perrin that you cannot walk away from what has to be done—Perrin heeds this advice. He is a very large man, which works well for work at the forge. His wife, [Alsbet](#Alsbet-Luhhan), is almost as large as he is, and nearly as strong.

name: Haral
info: Young man from Emond's Field who died in the Trolloc attack. _Not to be confused with the blacksmith of Emond's field, [Haral Luhhan](#Haral-Luhhan)._

name: Hari Coplin
info: Citizen of Emond's Field who “fawns” over the Whitecloaks. Like many members of his family, Hari tends to take the side of whoever he thinks is strongest, regardless of their agenda.

name: He Who Comes With the Dawn
info: Man the Aiel are searching for. He is prophesied to lead the Aiel out of the Three-Fold Land, born of their blood but raised by wetlanders.

name: Heartfang
chapter: Chapter 28: To the Tower of Ghenjei
info: What the wolves call the [Dark One](#Dark-One). The name is also used by humans.

name: Heartsbane
info: Alternative name for the Dark One.

name: Heirn
info: Aiel who brings the Jindo sept men to accompany [Amys](#Amys) to Rhuidean.

name: High King Artur Paendrag Tanreall
info: Hero of Legend who conquered much of the known world about a thousand years ago. He was perhaps the most strongly _ta'veren_ man in history besides [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon) and [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor). His armies put down those of [Guaire Amalasan](#Guaire-Amalasan), a false Dragon, and he even sent troops across the Aryth Ocean under his son, [Luthair Paendrag Mondwhin](#Luthair-Paendrag-Mondwhin), in hopes of conquering new lands there. All contact with these armies was lost at his death, which set off the War of the Hundred Years. The descendants of the armies under Luthair have now returned to reclaim the lands of his empire in the Old World—they now call themselves the Seanchan. He was known as [Artur Hawkwing](#Artur-Hawkwing) during most of his reign. His sign was a hawk in flight.

name: High Lady Alteima
info: Wife of [High Lord Tedosian](#High-Lord-Tedosian). [Thom](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin) forges a note about a relationship between her and [High Lord Carleon](#High-Lord-Carleon); it is unknown whether this relationship actually exists, or whether Thom was just trying to make two of the High Lords fight each other instead of [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor).

name: High Lady Estanda
info: A High Lady of Tear. She and [Alteima](#High-Lady-Alteima) are more than rivals, and [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) is more than willing to take advantage of that rivalry.

name: High Lady Suroth Sabelle Meldarath
info: Seanchan High Lady, ship captain, and battle leader. She has her head shaven on the sides and long, black hair in the middle. This is the typical Seanchan style for citizens “of the blood.” Suroth is determined to redeem herself after [High Lord Turak](#High-Lord-Turak-Aladon)'s mishap at Falme—she does not want to have to explain a failure that was not hers to the [Empress](#The-Empress-of-Seanchan-). She tried to gather all of the Seanchan ships that fled Falme so they would not go back home; she plans to attempt to retake the mainland again, destroying the man that threw them back the first time ([Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)). She has retreated and regrouped by conquering some of the outermost islands of the Sea Folk, and currently holds them by sinking any ships that might bring word of her forces' presence to those on the mainland.

name: High Lord Gueyam
info: High Lord of Tear. [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) sends him to assist [High Lord Meilan](#High-Lord-Meilan-Mendiana) in commanding the army.

name: High Lord Aracome
info: A High Lord of Tear. [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) sends him to assist [High Lord Meilan](#High-Lord-Meilan-Mendiana) in commanding the army.

name: High Lord Astoril Damara
info: A man whose daughters [Estean](#Lord-Estean-Andiama) has his eyes on.

name: High Lord Carleon
info: A High Lord of Tear. [Thom](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin) tries to copy his handwriting to plant a note to [Lady Alteima](#High-Lady-Alteima) saying that her husband suspected that they were having an affair. This note was an attempt to make [High Lord Tedosian](#High-Lord-Tedosian), Alteima's husband, angry with Carleon.

name: High Lord Hearne
info: A High Lord of Tear. [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) sends him to assist [High Lord Meilan](#High-Lord-Meilan-Mendiana) in commanding the army.

name: High Lord Maraconn
info: A High Lord of Tear. [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) sends him to assist [High Lord Meilan](#High-Lord-Meilan-Mendiana) in commanding the army.

name: High Lord Meilan Mendiana
info: Lean, gray-haired man with an “oily” voice. He is tall for a Tairen, only about a hand shorter than [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor).

name: High Lord Reimon
info: One of the High Lords of Tear. He plays cards with [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon). He has very big, broad shoulders.

name: High Lord Simaan
info: A High Lord of Tear. [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) sends him to assist [High Lord Meilan](#High-Lord-Meilan-Mendiana) in commanding the army.

name: High Lord Sunamon Haellin
info: One of the High Lords of Tear. A plump man. [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) holds him responsible for making a treaty with Mayene.

name: High Lord Tedosian
info: A High Lord of Tear, husband of [Lady Alteima](#High-Lady-Alteima). [Thom](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin) is trying to split the two up.

name: High Lord Turak Aladon
info: Commander of the Seanchan invasion force that landed at Falme. He was killed there when [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) and [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) led the heroes of the Horn of Valere against his army. He was a Blademaster, and was quite stunned when [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) was able to match him. He also kept a collection of rare _cuendillar_ objects, including (thanks in part to looting Bayle Domon's ship) two seals on the [Dark One](#Dark-One)'s prison.

name: Hopper
chapter: Chapter 28: To the Tower of Ghenjei
info: One of the wolves. Hopper died in a Whitecloak attack in real life, but he lives on in the World of Dreams, _Tel'aran'rhiod_.

name: Hornsounder
info: Name used by Fades and some other people “in-the-know” to refer to [Mat Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), in reference to him sounding the Horn of Valere.

name: Hu Barran
info: A stablehand at the Winespring Inn in Emond's Field.

name: Hu Marwin
chapter: Chapter 33: A New Weave in the Pattern
info: Best tracker among [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara)'s recruits. _Note that this Hu should not be confused with [Hu Barran](#Hu-Barran), the stablehand at the Winespring Inn, or [Hu al'Dai](#Hu-al-Dai), an older man from the Two Rivers._

name: Hu al'Dai
info: [Bili](#Bili-al-Dai)'s father.

name: Ihvon
info: A Warder, bonded to [Alanna](#Alanna-Mosvani). He stops [Marin](#Marin-al-Vere), [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara), etc. enroute to the old sickhouse.

name: Ila
info: Wife of [Raen](#Raen). A plump woman, gray-haired but not wrinkled. She is a head taller than her husband.

name: Ilyena Therin Moerelle
info: Wife of [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon) in the Age of Legends. [Lanfear](#Lanfear) despises her for taking Lews Therin away from her, and refers to her as a “milk-hearted, straw-haired chit.”

name: Isam Mandragoran
info: Man who was bringing Trollocs through the Ways to attack Emond's Field. He is the same Isam that disappeared into the Blight years ago.

name: Isendre
info: A young woman who travels with [Kadere](#Hadnan-Kadere). She returns [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s flirting.

name: Ishamael
info: One of the Forsaken. He was the most powerful of all the Forsaken, and leader of the Shadow's forces. [Alnora](#Alnora) believed, correctly, that he was not completely trapped in the sealing on the Bore. Ishamael masterminded many of the subtle plots that the Shadow used over the years—he also claims to have convinced the then insane [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon) to kill everyone he loved. Due to his barely being trapped in the Bore, his sanity was not completely intact for the 3000 years since the Breaking of the World.

name: Ispan Shefar
info: Aes Sedai of the Black Ajah, formerly of the Blue. [Captain Egeanin](#Captain-Egeanin), [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand), and [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara), posing as servants, are sent by the head chef to deliver her breakfast in the Panarch's Palace in Tarabon.

name: Ivon
info: A Child of the Light. He is one of [Dain Bornhald](#Dain-Bornhald)'s men in the army he takes to the Two Rivers.

name: Jac al'Seen
info: Farmer at whose farm [Tam](#Tamlin-Tam-al-Thor) plans to stop at around noon on the way to Watch Hill. Jac took in many of the people from surrounding farms when their farms were attacked by Trollocs.

name: Jaichim Carridin
info: Inquisitor for the Hand of the Light, better known as the Questioners. He frequents the Garden of Silver Breezes, an inn in Tanchico, and is the only man [Selindrin](#Selindrin) allows to enter the inn armed. Surprisingly enough for a Whitecloak, much less a Questioner, Carridin is a Darkfriend. He was given orders (under the name [Bors](#Bors)) by [Ishamael](#Ishamael) to find and kill [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor), and those orders were strengthened by a Myrddraal who promised to kill another member of Carridin's family every month until al'Thor was dead. So far, Carridin has lost a cousin (found skinned alive in his bed) and his youngest sister [Dealda](#Dealda-ni-Carridin) (carried from her bridal feast by a Fade). He expects his sister, [Vanora](#Vanora-Carridin), to be next.

name: Jaim Aybara
info: [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara)'s cousin. He tells Perrin of the rear attack on the Trollocs by the people from Watch Hill.

name: Jaim Thane
info: A boy who [Dav Ayellin](#Dav-Ayellin) saw running to tell [Loial](#Loial) that [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara) had come. He is [Jon Thane](#Jon-Thane)'s son.

name: Jaim Torfinn
chapter: Chapter 33: A New Weave in the Pattern
info: Best shot among [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara)'s recruits.

name: Jain Farstrider
info: Hero of a favorite book of the Emond's Fielders, _The Travels of Jain Farstrider_. He traveled all over the world, from the Aiel Waste to the Aryth Ocean, from the Sea of Storms to the Great Blight, on his horse Jeade'en. [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) used this name for his horse as well.

name: Jak o' the Wisps
info: According to [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara), something useless to chase. Possibly similar to a wild goose.

name: Janduin
chapter: Chapter 34: He Who Comes With The Dawn
info: [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s biological father, an Aiel of the Iron Mountain sept of the Taardad Aiel. He was the youngest clan chief of the Taardad Aiel in memory. He ended the blood feud between the Taardad and Nakai clans after over 200 years of fighting, and then allied not only with the Nakai, but with the Reyn Aiel as well (who were not much better than blood enemies before the alliance was made). He almost ended the blood feud between the Shaarad and Goshien clans (which still persists today, causing trouble for [Chiad](#Chiad) and [Gaul](#Gaul)), and would have if [King Laman](#King-Laman-Damodred) would not have cut down _[Avendoraldera](#Avendoraldera)_. He loved [Shaiel](#Shaiel), to the point where he could not refuse to let her fight in the Aiel War despite being with child. It was Janduin himself who led the four clans; Taardad, Nakai, Reyn, and Shaarad; across the Spine of the World to punish Laman for his Sin, throwing the entire world into war and allowing Prophecy to be fulfilled. It is said he was killed leading warriors in the Blight by man who looked so much like Shaiel that he was unable to raise his spear to defend himself.

name: Jared Aydaer
info: One of [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara)'s recruits. He was killed by the Trollocs when they attacked the patrol from behind.

name: Jaren
info: One of [Adan](#Adan)'s sons. He threw himself off a cliff at age nineteen when he found that he could channel.

name: Jaret Byar
info: Second-in-command under [Dain Bornhald](#Dain-Bornhald) over the army of Whitecloaks in the Two Rivers. Byar held fierce loyalty to Dain's father, [Geofram](#Geofram-Bornhald), and transferred that loyalty to Dain when he died.

name: Jaric Mondoran
info: Man who will arrive at the meeting between the Aes Sedai during [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s seventh step through the columns of Rhuidean. It is presumed he was able to channel, and will assist them in keeping the two items safe from men who can channel in the future (until the [Dragon](#The-Dragon) is Reborn). One of the Aes Sedai present points out that there can be no mistakes since he and [Haindar](#Haindar) are due to arrive the next day. Jaric killed a group of Aiel who tried to turn him to the Way of the Leaf by singing to him, which caused the Aes Sedai to be wary of his sanity (or lack thereof).

name: Jasin Natael
info: The gleeman who travels with [Kadere](#Hadnan-Kadere). He is very interested in learning about Rhuidean.

name: Jeade'en
info: [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s stallion. His name means “true finder” in the Old Tongue. Rand chose it because it was the name of [Jain Farstrider](#Jain-Farstrider)'s horse, and he hoped the horse would serve him as well as the original Jeade'en served Jain.

name: Jeaine Caide
info: Aes Sedai of the Black Ajah from Arad Doman. She was openly Green Ajah until she left with [Liandrin](#Liandrin). She has coppery skin and a swan-like neck, and is fond of thin, clinging dresses. This figure and taste is similar to how [Leane](#Leane-Sharif) acts, dresses, and looks, and is typical of a Domani woman.

name: Jeordam
chapter: Chapter 25: The Road to the Spear
info: Aiel from [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s second step through the columns of Rhuidean. He is [Rhodric](#Rhodric)'s greatfather.

name: Jerinvar (Jer) Barstere
info: Wide-nosed, leathery-faced, white-haired mayor of Watch Hill. He and the Village Council plan to see that the Whitecloaks leave the Two Rivers.

name: Jheran
chapter: Chapter 28: To the Tower of Ghenjei
info: Clan chief of the Shaarad Aiel, [Gaul](#Gaul)'s clan.

name: Joar Addam Nesossin
info: [Asmodean](#Asmodean)'s name during the Age of Legends, before he turned to the Shadow.

name: Joelin
info: One of two Whitecloaks killed in a skirmish with Trollocs. [Dain](#Dain-Bornhald) thinks it more than coincidence that Joelin and [Gomanes](#Gomanes) were the only ones killed; he had sent the two of them to make certain [Ordeith](#Ordeith) was not creating havoc.

name: Joiya Byir
info: Aes Sedai of the Black Ajah, formerly of the White. She lost none of her cool self-possession when changing her loyalties to the Shadow. She was captured by [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere), [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand), and [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) after the taking of the Stone of Tear. She is the oldest of the Black sisters who left the Tower with [Liandrin](#Liandrin), old enough to be the grandmother of the girls who are hunting her.

name: Jolien
info: One of the Aiel. [Aviendha](#Aviendha) suggests him as a person to escort [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) to Cold Rocks Hold.

name: Joline Maza
chapter: Chapter 47: The Truth of a Viewing
info: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah. She is one of [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan)'s supporters, one of the sisters who arrested [Siuan](#Siuan-Sanche).

name: Jom
info: Man who knocks [Charn](#Charn) over by mistake. He apologized when he realized that Charn was Aiel.

name: Jon Gaelin
chapter: Chapter 33: A New Weave in the Pattern
info: Farmer who lives on the North Road. [Jac al'Seen](#Jac-al-Seen) plans to reach his farm before sunset the day [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara) convinces him to leave for Emond's Field.

name: Jon Thane
info: Miller of Emond's Field. His mill is at the far east side of the city.

name: Jonai
info: An Aiel who appears in [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s sixth step through the columns of Rhuidean.

name: Jorin din Jubai White Wing
info: Sister to [Coine](#Coine-din-Jubai-Wild-Winds), and Windfinder of _Wavedancer_. She is one of the Windfinders among the Sea Folk who can channel the One Power; she can handle extremely thick flows of Air. [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) became good friends with her while on her ship, and the two learned a lot from each other.

name: Joslyn Aybara
info: [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara)'s mother. She called [Ordeith](#Ordeith) a filthy-minded little fool for naming her son Darkfriend. She died with her husband.

name: Juilin Sandar
info: Thief-catcher from Tear. He accompanies [Thom](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin) on the journey to Tanchico with [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) and [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara).

name: Justice
info: Legendary sword carried by [Artur Hawkwing](#Artur-Hawkwing).

name: Kari al'Thor
info: [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s mother. Kari was not actually his biological mother; Rand's real mother was a Maiden of the Spear who bore him on Dragonmount where he was found by Kari's husband, [Tam](#Tamlin-Tam-al-Thor). Kari met Tam while he was stationed in Caemlyn during his military duties, and the two got married. They returned to Tam's home, Emond's Field, with the child he found on the mountain at the end of the Aiel War, which they named Rand. Kari died when Rand was about five years old; she was the only mother Rand ever knew, and all he remembers of her is her soft touch.

name: Keeper of the Chronicles
info: Essentially the secretary to the [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat). The Keeper is traditionally from the same Ajah from which the Amyrlin was raised. The office is currently occupied by [Leane Sharif](#Leane-Sharif) of the Blue Ajah.

name: Keille Shaogi
info: Heavy woman who travels with [Kadere](#Hadnan-Kadere). She sells [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) his hat for a gold mark. She is a very strange character, who knows odd information about the world.

name: Kenley Ahan
chapter: Chapter 33: A New Weave in the Pattern
info: One of [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara)'s recruits. He knows his way around Watch Hill better than anyone else in the group.

name: Kevrim al'Azar
info: Very old man from Emond's Field. His grandsons have grown sons of their own.

name: King Galldrian su Riatin Rie
info: King of Cairhien, Defender of the Dragonwall. He died in the riots that accompanied [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s departure.

name: King Laman Damodred
info: King of Cairhien before the Aiel War. In order to build his new throne, Laman cut down _[Avendoraldera](#Avendoraldera)_, a Chora tree that grew in the center of the city of Cairhien. This act, known as Laman's Sin, prompted three clans of the Aiel to cross the Spine of the World and avenge the death of the tree by taking his life. The tree had gift from the Aiel in gratitude for the hospitality the people of Cairhien had displayed to them in the past. It is unknown whether Laman knew of the significance of _Avendoraldera_, or of the reason the Aiel allowed the people of his kingdom to cross the Waste. The fact that he cut the tree down and brought the Aiel over the Dragonwall allowed Prophesy to be fulfilled and the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn) to be born on the slopes of Dragonmount, born of the ancient blood (Aiel) and raised by the old (Manetheren). He is [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred)'s aunt.

name: Kinslayer
info: Name given to [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon) after he killed his family in his madness.

name: Kirin
chapter: Chapter 25: The Road to the Spear
info: [Morin](#Morin)'s daughter. She was kidnapped by the people with swords.

name: Kodam
info: Man [Oselle](#Oselle) is afraid to trust. He is young and not yet touched by the taint, or so the Aes Sedai hope.

name: Lady Leitha
info: A Lady of the Land of Tear. She has a horse-face.

name: Lady Medore Damara
info: Person with “two or three pretty maids.” [Estean](#Lord-Estean-Andiama) is interested in her, and possibly her maids as well…. She is the daughter of [High Lord Astoril](#High-Lord-Astoril-Damara).

name: Laefar
info: An Ogier from Stedding Shangtai. He and [Loial](#Loial) met up while he was in Tear negotiating repairs on some Ogier stonework. Loial is convinced that Laefar will inform his mother of where he is, and she will try to find him and marry him off. From Loial's description, his sense of humor is not agreeable.

name: Laila (née Dearn) Lewin
info: Stout young woman staying with [Jac al'Seen](#Jac-al-Seen) on his farm. [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara) remembers her as a slim girl “who could dance three boys into the ground.” Perrin used to dream about marrying her, and she him; Perrin let go of the idea before she did. She is now married to [Natley Lewin](#Natley-Lewin), and has a small child.

name: Lanfear
info: One of the Forsaken. Her name means “Daughter of the Night” in the Old Tongue; unlike the rest of the Forsaken, she chose the name herself. She was the second strongest of the Forsaken (after [Ishamael](#Ishamael)). Before she turned to the Shadow, before [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon) met [Ilyena](#Ilyena-Therin-Moerelle) (who Lanfear refers to as a “straw-haired chit”), she was his lover. She now plans to reclaim “her” man, [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor), even though he is a different person....

name: Laras
info: The Mistress of the Kitchens in the White Tower. [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw) describes her as “a winecask on legs”; she is a very large woman.

name: Leafblighter
chapter: Chapter 28: To the Tower of Ghenjei
info: Alternative name for the [Dark One](#Dark-One).

name: Leane Sharif
info: The [Keeper of the Chronicles](#Keeper-of-the-Chronicles) under [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche); an Aes Sedai of the Blue Ajah. She is very tall for a woman, as tall as most men, and has coppery skin. She grew up in Arad Doman. Siuan thinks (correctly) that Leane would lay down her life for her, but she is still reluctant to tell her _everything_ she does, particularly her efforts to root out the Black Ajah.

name: Leilwin
info: Taraboner noblewoman from refugee estates near Tanchico that were burned in the war. [Gelb](#Floran-Gelb) kidnapped her, thinking she was one of the women [Captain Egeanin](#Captain-Egeanin) sought.

name: Leof Torfinn
info: Young man from Emond's Field. He carries the small wolf banner at first.

name: Lewin
chapter: Chapter 25: The Road to the Spear
info: Tall, graying Aiel that [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) sees on his third step through the columns of Rhuidean. In that vision, he never smiled. In later viewings, Lewin was the man who violated the Way of the Leaf by killing the men who kidnapped his family and would have killed him. All of the Aiel (with the exception of the Jenn) are most likely descendants of him and the other boys with him; they will never touch a sword (since a sword can only be used to kill a man), but since Lewin killed with a spear, the Aiel prefer spears as their primary weapons.

name: Lews Therin Telamon
info: The [Dragon](#The-Dragon), Breaker of the World. He was perhaps the greatest man who ever lived, and the most powerful Aes Sedai in recorded history. During the War of the Shadow, he lead the forces of the Light against the Forsaken, and led the final stroke which re-sealed the [Dark One](#Dark-One) back into his prison. Unfortunately, during this stroke he was driven insane by the Dark One's touch, eventually killing his wife, his children, and everyone he loved, as well as anyone who carried a drop of his blood. For this act, people remember him with a new name: [Kinslayer](#Kinslayer). After he had done this, [Ishamael](#Ishamael) gave him his sanity back long enough for him to realize what he had done; Lews Therin then killed himself by drawing on _saidin_ too heavily, causing a mountain to form on the spot where he stood. This mountain is called Dragonmount, and is near the present-day city of Tar Valon. It is unfortunate that the name of one of the greatest men to ever live is now synonymous with evil, for Lews Therin killed his kin due to the Dark One's influence, but without Lews Therin there may not have been a world left in which to kill them.

name: Lian
info: Mother-sister to [Aviendha](#Aviendha), sister-wife to [Amys](#Amys), wife of [Rhuarc](#Rhuarc).

name: Liandrin
info: Leader of the group of thirteen Aes Sedai who declared themselves Black Ajah and fled the White Tower, murdering guards and even sisters in the process. She is one of three Black sisters that [Amico](#Amico-Nagoyin) knew of before leaving the Tower. She has a face like a doll. Liandrin was Red Ajah before turning Black, but her oath to the Black was sworn only days (perhaps hours) after her raising to the shawl, so it cannot really be said that she was ever Red Ajah at all. Her father sold fruit on the street.

name: Lini Eltring
info: Nurse to both [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) and [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) during their childhoods. She used to say that you could weave silk from pig bristles before you could make a man anything but a man, as well as hundreds of other wise sayings.

name: Logain Ablar
info: False Dragon who led Ghealdan, Altara, and Amadicia to civil war before being captured and gentled by Aes Sedai. He was quite strong in the One Power.

name: Loial
info: Ogier from Stedding Shangtai, son of [Arent](#Arent) son of [Halan](#Halan). He is fond of books and history, and is an excellent Treesinger. He is writing a book about his travels with the three _ta'veren_ he meets, [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor), [Mat Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), and [Perrin Aybara](#Perrin-Aybara). Loial is constantly afraid that his mother will find him and try to marry him off and settle him down; he is only ninety years old, which by Ogier standards is not yet old enough to leave the _stedding_ by himself. Loial is sad that most humans do not remember the Ogier—and horrified that some see him and think he is a Trolloc.

name: Lord Baran
info: One of the men who plays cards with [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon).

name: Lord Brys
info: Tarabon nobleman. One of his servants let it spill to [Gelb](#Floran-Gelb) that the assembly was choosing a new Panarch. _Not to be confused with Ethenielle's husband._

name: Lord Captain Commander Pedron Niall
info: Lord Captain Commander of the Children of the Light, the equivalent to their king (if they were a nation). [Siuan](#Siuan-Sanche) knows that he will not order [Valda](#Lord-Captain-Eamon-Valda) to march on Tar Valon unless he thinks the Aes Sedai are injured. He is quite old, but still has his wits about him; he is admired and feared by many, and is one of the best battle commanders alive.

name: Lord Captain Eamon Valda
info: Lord Captain of the Children of the Light stationed near Tar Valon. [Siuan](#Siuan-Sanche) believes that Valda will not march on the city unless [Pedron Niall](#Lord-Captain-Commander-Pedron-Niall) gives him the order, and Niall will not march unless he thinks the Aes Sedai are vulnerable. Valda is [Dain Bornhald](#Dain-Bornhald)'s superior; Dain's father worried that his son would blindly follow Valda's orders.

name: Lord Carlomin
info: One of the men who plays cards with [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon).

name: Lord Edorion Selorna
info: Plump, pink-cheeked man who plays cards with [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon). He always reacts to his cards in the same way, as if he had been dealt all low single cards, but he wins just as often as anyone else (except Mat).

name: Lord Estean Andiama
info: Plain-faced youth with lank hair. He could pass for a farmer, or so [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) thinks, despite being the son of [High Lord Torean](#Torean-Andiama), the wealthiest of the High Lords of Tear.

name: Lord Gaebril
info: New advisor to [Queen Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) of Andor. [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) overheard him giving orders to kill [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) while in the garden outside Gaebril's room. Elayne believes her mother to be too strong to let herself be influenced by a man, but Gaebril seems to be doing so quite effectively.

name: Lord Gareth Bryne
info: First Prince of the Sword and Captain of the Queen's Guards under [Queen Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) in Andor. He was appointed to this position because Morgase had no living male relatives. Bryne does not get along well with Morgase's new advisor and lover, [Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril). He is one of the best living military commanders, possibly one of the best ever.

name: Lord Luc Chiendelna
info: An alleged Hunter of the Horn who stops in Emond's Field. He was trying to find the Horn of Valere, which he says he thinks is somewhere in the Mountains of Mist, and stopped in Emond's Field to “help” the people defend themselves against the Whitecloaks.

name: Lord Taringail Damodred
info: [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand)'s first husband, and father of [Galad](#Galadedrid-Galad-Damodred), [Gawyn](#Gawyn-Trakand), and [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand). He died years ago. According to [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred), he planned to engineer the death of Morgase and make himself the first king of Andor in its history. Taringail was also the husband of the former Daughter-Heir of Andor, Tigraine, who was Galad's mother. In fact, Morgase married him to firm up her support for the throne.

name: Lord of the Grave
info: Alternative name for the Dark One.

name: Lothair Mantelar
info: Author of _The Way of the Light_ and founder of the Children of the Light. [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw) thinks the book to be “dry nonsense,” but [Galad](#Galadedrid-Galad-Damodred) thinks it to be pure genius. The book is required reading among new recruits to the Children.

name: Luca
chapter: Chapter 25: The Road to the Spear
info: Aiel who is with [Lewin](#Lewin) in [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s fourth step through the columns of Rhuidean. He has big shoulders and is quite fond of tricks.

name: Lucellin
info: Whitecloak officer who is ordered to make sure no one “slips away” from the town they sack.

name: Luthair Paendrag Mondwhin
info: Son of [Artur Hawkwing](#Artur-Hawkwing) who led forces across the Aryth Ocean. When they landed there, he led them to conquer the continent they found for themselves, and declared himself Emperor. His descendants are the Seanchan “of the Blood,” and the rest of the Seanchan are descended from his troops and the native inhabitants.

name: Machin Shin
info: The Black Wind. It is a creation of the Ways that consumes the soul of any living creature it encounters. It is not known whether _Machin Shin_ is a creation of the [Dark One](#Dark-One) or a thing spawned by the taint on the Ways.

name: Maedin Bashere
info: [Faile](#Faile-Bashere)'s brother. He is two years younger than she. When their father sent him to the Blightborder, it pushed Faile over the edge and she ran away to join the Great Hunt of the Horn.

name: Magde Aybara
info: [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara)'s aunt, [Eward](#Eward-Aybara)'s wife.

name: Maigran
chapter: Chapter 25: The Road to the Spear
info: [Lewin](#Lewin)'s sister.

name: Mandarb
info: [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran)'s black stallion. His name means “blade” in the Old Tongue.

name: Mandein
chapter: Chapter 25: The Road to the Spear
info: The man [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) becomes on his first step into the stone columns in Rhuidean. He is [Sealdre](#Sealdre)'s husband.

name: Mandhuin
chapter: Chapter 57: A Breaking in the Three-fold Land
info: Heavyset, gray-haired man, of the Goshien Aiel.

name: Mangin
info: Aiel of the Jindo sept of the Taardad Aiel. He was on guard at [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s door. He and [Gaul](#Gaul) made a wager that [High Lord Torean](#Torean-Andiama) would not slide as far as the carvings down the hall when Rand threw him out. He did not, so Mangin won.

name: Mara Tomanes
chapter: Chapter 47: The Truth of a Viewing
info: Allegedly an Aes Sedai in Illian under whom [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) and [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) are studying. [Siuan](#Siuan-Sanche) was friends with her as a girl, but had not even thought of her since she left home. She thought of her when [Gawyn](#Gawyn-Trakand) demanded to know where Egwene and his sister were, and used her as their excuse to be out of the Tower; Gawyn assumed she could not lie, but the Three Oaths were severed when she was stilled.

name: Mara
info: Woman from one of [Thom Merrilin](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin)'s gleeman tales, “Mara and the Three Foolish Kings.”

name: Marillin Gemalphin
info: Aes Sedai of the Black Ajah. She is quite fond of cats, and is rarely seen without one. She was publicly Brown Ajah until she left with [Liandrin](#Liandrin).

name: Marin al'Vere
info: [Bran](#Brandelwyn-Bran-al-Vere)'s wife, and [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere)'s mother. She is used to getting her way most of the time. She is an important figure in the Women's Circle of Emond's Field.

name: Marind
info: [Adan](#Adan)'s daughter. She died the morning her sister [Rhea](#Rhea) was captured.

name: Maseem
info: Mispronunciation of [Mazrim Taim](#Mazrim-Taim) by a man in Tear from Lugard.

name: Masema Dagar
chapter: Chapter 47: The Truth of a Viewing
info: Man known in Ghealdan as The Prophet, who was with [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) when he fought the battle at Falme. He now preaches the coming of the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn), and garners support for him. He is of questionable sanity.

name: Master Jovarin
chapter: Chapter 47: The Truth of a Viewing
