info: Head mason in the White Tower. He finds many books for [Danelle](#Danelle), which [Siuan](#Siuan-Sanche) thinks are distracting Danelle from how many extra men he seems to be hiring. In reality, the extra masons are soldiers.

name: Matrim (Mat) Cauthon
info: A young man from Emond's Field. He is _ta'veren_. Along with his good friends, [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor) and [Perrin Aybara](#Perrin-Aybara), he left home to escape the Trolloc attack on Winternight. On the way to Tar Valon, he picked up a dagger from Shadar Logoth tainted with the evil that destroyed Aridhol, which he carried with him for a long time. He was separated from the dagger by Aes Sedai Healing, but doing so caused large gaps in his memory sequence, gaps which he desperately wants to fill. Mat's _ta'veren_ qualities manifest themselves particularly well with random events, such as dice games—he almost never loses a toss of the dice, even if the dice are weighted. He has four sisters, including [Eldrin](#Eldrin-Cauthon) and [Bodewhin](#Bodewhin-Bode-Cauthon), who are 16 and 17, respectively. His father [Abell](#Abell-Cauthon) is one of the best archers in the Two Rivers, possibly in the world. Mat has gotten in the habit of carrying concealed knives under his clothes in case he is attacked—his collection would surprise anyone. Mat promised [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) he would carry a letter for her to her mother in Caemlyn in exchange for safe passage out of Tar Valon. While in the Palace, he overheard a conversation between two men plotting to kill Elayne—one of these men turned out to be [Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril), [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand)'s new advisor and lover. Mat continued on to Tear in an attempt to save Elayne, [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere), and [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) from Gaebril's men. He saved all three women from the Black Ajah's captivity in the Stone, and remains a guest in the Stone of Tear.

name: Mazrim Taim
info: False Dragon from Saldaea. He can channel with great strength. According to [Joiya](#Joiya-Byir), [Liandrin](#Liandrin) plans to set him free and use him as a tool to conquer the world for the Shadow.

name: Melaine
info: Aiel Wise One of the Jhirad sept of the Goshien Aiel. She is a Dreamwalker, and one of [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere)'s teachers. She can channel, and is quite young.

name: Merk
info: A man who allegedly fought with spears of fire in the Age prior to the Age of Legends. He and and his companion [Mosk](#Mosk) were also said to be giants. Their story is the oldest story [Thom](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin) knows, and he knows quite well that it is greatly exaggerated.

name: Mesaana
info: One of the Forsaken.

name: Midean
info: Man after which Midean's Ford is named.

name: Mierin Eronaile
info: Aes Sedai that [Charn](#Charn) serves in [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s ninth step through the columns of Rhuidean. Charn had already received Mierin's blessing to marry [Nalla](#Nalla) at that point. Mierin thought she had found a new Source for the One Power, one that did not have separate halves for males and females. The power she had actually discovered turned out to be emissions from the [Dark One](#Dark-One)'s prison; when she bored into it, the Dark One was able to touch the world for the first time in thousands of years.

name: Milli Ayellin
info: Woman from Emond's Field. She brought the mini wolf banner to Wil al'Seen, but he didn't want to carry it.

name: Mist
info: [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere)'s gray mare.

name: Mistress Ahan
info: [Kenley](#Kenley-Ahan)'s mother. A handsome woman with streaks of white in her black braid.

name: Mistress al'Taron
info: [Dael](#Dael-al-Taron)'s mother. She keeps asking where he is when [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara) and his team come back. Perrin feels awful because he hasn't the heart to tell her that her son is dead, most likely in the stomach of a Trolloc, because he was not prepared.

name: Mistress Elidar
info: An alias assumed by Captain Egeanin

name: Mistress of Novices
info: Aes Sedai in charge of novice training in the White Tower. She serves as both a disciplinarian and a shoulder to cry on for girls who need either. The current Mistress of Novices is [Sheriam Bayanar](#Sheriam-Bayanar) of the Blue Ajah.

name: Moghedien
info: One of the Forsaken. Her name means “spider” in the Old Tongue. She is a master of deceit and treachery, and is the supreme ruler in _Tel'aran'rhiod_, the World of Dreams.

name: Moiraine Damodred
info: Aes Sedai of the Blue Ajah. Born as Lady Moiraine of House Damodred in Cairhien. She is [Taringail Damodred](#Lord-Taringail-Damodred)'s youngest half-sister, and [King Laman](#King-Laman-Damodred)'s niece. She is strong in the One Power, and is Talented at Healing. Along with [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche), her friend as a novice, she dedicated her life to finding and guiding the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn) after hearing of his birth Foretold by [Gitara Moroso](#Gitara-Moroso), who was then [Keeper of the Chronicles](#Keeper-of-the-Chronicles). Her Warder is [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran), the uncrowned king of Malkier. She is determined to guide [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) to what must be done, and is very confident in herself that she knows the way.

name: Moraine
chapter: Chapter 57: A Breaking in the Three-fold Land
info: Misspelling of [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred).

name: Mordaine
chapter: Chapter 25: The Road to the Spear
info: One of the spokesmen for the Jenn Aiel in the Rhuidean visions.

name: Morgase Trakand
info: By the Grace of the Light, Queen of Andor, Defender of the Realm, Protector of the People, High Seat of House Trakand. Mother to [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) and [Gawyn](#Gawyn-Trakand). She was trained in the White Tower, as all Queens of Andor have, but was too weak in the One Power to do anything worthwhile with the knowledge she learned there.

name: Moria Elward
info: [Sahra Covenry](#Sahra-Covenry)'s taskmistress on the penance farm. She was not a harsh taskmistress, but Sahra did not come to the White Tower to work on a farm. She was killed by the same person who killed Sahra.

name: Morin
chapter: Chapter 25: The Road to the Spear
info: Yellow-haired Aiel woman from [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s third step through the columns of Rhuidean. She relates the losses that their clan incurred when the men with swords came through.

name: Moshea
info: A Tinker who is putting new wheels on his wagon.

name: Mosk
info: A man who allegedly fought with spears of fire in the Age prior to the Age of Legends. He and and his companion [Merk](#Merk) were also said to be giants. Their story is the oldest story [Thom](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin) knows, and he knows quite well that it is greatly exaggerated.

name: Muradin
info: Aiel of the Shaido clan who goes to Rhuidean to become the clan chief after [Suladric](#Suladric)'s death.

name: Nalla
info: Woman who [Charn](#Charn) plans to marry during [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s ninth step through the columns of Rhuidean. He had put her off for nearly a year because he didn't want to settle down.

name: Narisse
chapter: Chapter 25: The Road to the Spear
info: A spokesman for the Jenn Aiel in the Rhuidean visions.

name: Natley Lewin
info: [Laila](#Laila-n-e-Dearn-Lewin)'s pudgy husband. He never could dance, which surprises [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara), since his wife always loved to.

name: Natti Cauthon
info: [Abell](#Abell-Cauthon)'s wife, [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s mother. She and two of her daughters were arrested by the Whitecloaks as Darkfriends because of [Fain](#Padan-Fain)'s suggestions that Mat is a Darkfriend.

name: Neain Aybara
info: [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara)'s aunt, [Carlin](#Carlin-Aybara)'s widow. She visits her husband's grave every morning.

name: Nela al'Caar
info: Woman from Emond's Field. She wanted to ask [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara) if it was safe for children to play in some parts of the city. She already knew the answer, but she thought she should ask him, anyway.

name: Nerrine
chapter: Chapter 25: The Road to the Spear
info: [Colline](#Colline), [Charlin](#Charlin), and [Alijha](#Alijha)'s mother.

name: Neysa Ayellin
info: Horse-faced woman from Emond's Field. [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara) remembers when she paddled him for stealing one of her gooseberry pies, on [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s suggestion, when he was ten.

name: Nynaeve al'Meara
info: A young woman from Emond's Field, now one of the Accepted. She has exceptional potential, and will most likely be the most powerful Aes Sedai since the Age of Legends. However, Nynaeve's channeling is obstructed due to the fact that she had to learn to control her ability herself without really knowing what she was controlling: she is a wilder. She can only touch the True Source when she is extremely angry (thereby letting her guard down and circumventing her block). Along with [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) and [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand), Nynaeve is one of three people [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche) trusts in the Tower; Siuan is convinced through their actions to date that they cannot possibly be Darkfriends. She sent them on a dangerous mission: spring the obvious trap the Black Ajah had set for them, and see if they can catch them in the process. Nynaeve has developed feelings for [Lan Mandragoran](#al-Lan-Mandragoran), [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred)'s Warder, and he shares those feelings despite his insistence that it is inappropriate and dangerous to act on them. Nynaeve blames Moiraine herself for disrupting her village's life and endangering the lives of the four people she spirited away when the Trollocs attacked Emond's Field. She wishes to learn how to control her ability so she can get even—to put Moiraine in her place, as it were—and to study and perfect the art of Healing. She is currently in the Stone of Tear, following the aftermath of the battle with [Be'lal](#Be-lal) and the taking of the Stone.

name: Old Grim
info: Alternative name for the Dark One.

name: Ordeith
info: Name assumed by [Padan Fain](#Padan-Fain) while he is among the Children of the Light. He gives advice and counsel to [Pedron Niall](#Lord-Captain-Commander-Pedron-Niall) and [Dain Bornhald](#Dain-Bornhald).

name: Oselle
info: Aes Sedai from [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s seventh step through the columns of Rhuidean who was at the meeting where the Aes Sedai discussed the final fate of _Callandor_ and the Dragon Banner.

name: Owein
info: One of [Alanna](#Alanna-Mosvani)'s Warders. He was killed by the Whitecloaks when he got too close to their camp. Alanna felt every arrow go in via their bond.

name: Owyn Merrilin
info: [Thom](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin)'s nephew. He could channel. He was found by the Red Ajah and gentled on the spot; this goes against the custom of taking the man to the Tower to be gentled, and then helping him to stay alive afterwards. Thom never forgave the Aes Sedai for their misdeed, and is almost willing to do anything to avenge Owyn's wrongful fate.

name: Padan Fain
info: Former peddler who came to Emond's Field frequently with news of the outside world. The true purpose of his visits were to find a list of young men who might be the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn)—he was collecting this information as a Darkfriend, passing it on to [Ishamael](#Ishamael) when he was able to narrow the list. He finally selected three possible: [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor), [Perrin Aybara](#Perrin-Aybara), and [Mat Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), who were born within weeks of one another during the Aiel War. Fain was then given orders to follow the three men, and on the way went through Shadar Logoth, where he encountered the spirit of Mordeth. Mordeth attempted to consume his soul and take over his body, but instead the two spirits merged, creating something more evil than either of them alone. Fain eventually hooked up with the Children of the Light, and managed to become advisor to [Pedron Niall](#Lord-Captain-Commander-Pedron-Niall), the Lord Captain Commander of the Children, using the name [Ordeith](#Ordeith). Fain is a very dangerous man: it is said, “The look of the Eyeless (Myrddraal) is fear.” However, Fades have the same feeling of fear looking at Fain as normal people have looking at Myrddraal. Fain is likely the most dangerous creation in the world, with the possible exception of the [Dark One](#Dark-One) himself.

name: Paetram Aybara
info: [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara)'s nine-year-old brother.

name: Paet al'Caar
info: Citizen of Emond's Field.

name: Paetram
info: A man in a tavern in Tear that informs [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) of the rumors of Whitecloaks in the Two Rivers.

name: Panarch Farede
info: Panarch of Tarabon near the end of the War of the Hundred Years. She was responsible for promulgating the calendar that now bears her name, which measures years of the New Era (NE), the first of which marked the (arbitrary) end of the War.

name: Pel Aydaer
info: Bald man from Emond's Field. He taught [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara) how to catch trout with his bare hands.

name: Perrin Aybara
info: A young man from Emond's Field. He is _ta'veren_. When he and [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) got separated from the rest of the group while fleeing the Trollocs on Winternight, Perrin met a man named [Elyas Machera](#Elyas-Machera). Elyas, a former Warder who found he could talk to wolves, helped Perrin discover the same ability in himself. Perrin's eyes are now yellow, just like the wolves' eyes, and he can enter what he calls the Wolf Dream (known to most as _Tel'aran'rhiod_, the World of Dreams) with them. Perrin is a childhood friend of fellow _ta'veren_ [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor) and [Mat Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon). On the way to Tear, Perrin encountered a young woman by the name of [Zarine Bashere](#Zarine-Bashere), a Hunter for the Horn who took the name of [Faile](#Faile-Bashere) (which means “Falcon” in the Old Tongue) as a more appropriate name for a hunter for the horn. The two have grown to love each other. Perrin is a very large man—he was always a big person, which caused him to be very cautious since he found as a child that he could easily hurt other children if his temper got out of hand. His size helped considerably when helping [Master Luhhan](#Haral-Luhhan) on his forge, but sometimes gives others the impression that he is slow and stupid.

name: Pips
info: [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s brown gelding. He is a good horse, but it takes a trained eye to see that; Mat has one of the best eyes in the land for horses. The name is also what the dots on dice are called; Mat used it in hopes that the horse would bring him as much luck as the dice do.

name: Pura
info: A former Aes Sedai of the Yellow Ajah, now captured as a _damane_ by the Seanchan. Her real name was Ryma Galfrey, but the Seanchan do not care what her real name is; they will always call her Pura.

name: Queen Comaelle
info: Queen of Jaramide in the years around 325 AB, during the Third Age.

name: Queen Tenobia si Bashere Kazadi
info: Queen of Saldaea; her palace is in Maradon. She is the niece of [Davram Bashere](#Davram-t-Ghaline-Bashere) and a cousin of [Faile](#Faile-Bashere).

name: Raen
info: Tinker who receives the orders from [Farran](#Farran). He is the leader of the group of Tinkers in the Two Rivers, the same group that [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara) and [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) encountered on their way out of Emond's Field.

name: Rahvin
info: One of the Forsaken.

name: Rand al'Thor
info: The [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn). He was raised as a shepherd in Emond's Field, but his birthplace was on the slopes of Dragonmount. His father, [Tam](#Tamlin-Tam-al-Thor), found him freezing cold and orphaned while fighting Aiel on the mountain, and took him home with him and raised him as a son. Rand is _ta'veren_, perhaps the most strongly so since the [Dragon](#The-Dragon) himself, even more strongly than [Arturn Hawkwing](#Artur-Hawkwing). Rand has already fulfilled many prophecies of the [Dragon](#The-Dragon), including being born on the slopes of Dragonmount, being marked with herons on his palms, and taking the Stone of Tear and _Callandor_. According to [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw)'s viewings, Rand is destined to fall in love with three women, one of which is Min, and the other of which is [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand). The third is unknown to Min, and Rand as well. Rand is fated to one day face the [Dark One](#Dark-One) himself in Tarmon Gai'don, the Last Battle. He is quite tall, as tall as most Aiel men. Rand fights the Shadow along with his childhood friends, [Mat Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) and [Perrin Aybara](#Perrin-Aybara), who are also _ta'veren_, but much weaker. Rand is also very good friends with fellow Emond's Fielder [Egwene al'Vere](#Egwene-al-Vere)—Rand and Egwene were expected to marry by everyone in the village including themselves, but they realized that their feelings for each other were more like siblings than like spouses. Rand is the destiny of the entire world—should he die, the hope for the world would most likely die with him.

name: Raolin Darksbane
info: Man who proclaimed himself to be the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn) before the Trolloc Wars began. He was the first false Dragon of significance who could channel. His armies attempted to free him before he was gentled.

name: Ren Chandin
info: One of [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara)'s recruits. He was killed by the Trollocs when they attacked the patrol from behind.

name: Rendra
info: Innkeeper of the Three Plum Court, an inn in Tanchico where [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) and [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) stay. [Bayle Domon](#Bayle-Domon) knows her well.

name: Rhea
info: [Adan](#Adan)'s last living child on [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s fifth step or so through the columns of Rhuidean. She was taken prisoner by the “wetlanders.”

name: Rhodric
chapter: Chapter 25: The Road to the Spear
info: [Comran](#Comran)'s greatfather. He led the Aiel to kill armored soldiers who crossed the Spine of the World. He is also the person through whose eyes [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) sees in his second step through the columns of Rhuidean.

name: Rhuarc
info: Clan chief of the Taardad Aiel. He is very tall, and has gray in his hair. He and [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran) might strike sparks if they stared at each other long enough. He takes little nonsense from anyone. He has two wives—[Amys](#Amys), a Wise One, and [Lian](#Lian), Roofmistress of Shende Hold. He is a member of the Jindo sept.

name: Riana
info: Misspelling of [Rianna Andomeran](#Rianna-Andomeran)'s first name. _This mistake has been fixed in the paperback edition._

name: Rianna Andomeran
info: Aes Sedai of the Black Ajah, openly a member of the White Ajah until she left the Tower with [Liandrin](#Liandrin). She is one of three Black sisters that [Amico](#Amico-Nagoyin) knew of before leaving the Tower. She has a white streak above her left ear, which makes her easy to spot.

name: Sahra Covenry
info: Black-haired novice, perhaps 15 or 16, who escorts [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw) to the [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat)'s study. On the way, the two ran into [Gawyn](#Gawyn-Trakand), who was on his way out of the Amyrlin's study, and Sahra heard nothing of the conversation that Min and Gawyn had due to her going “calf-eyed” over him.

name: Samel Crawe
chapter: Chapter 53: The Price of a Departure
info: Citizen of Emond's Field. He sits on the Village Council.

name: Sammael
info: One of the Forsaken. His name means “Destroyer of Hope” in the Old Tongue. He rules Illian. [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) suggested him as a source of his mirror images attacking him until [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred) suggests that it was a “bubble of evil” from the [Dark One](#Dark-One) himself.

name: Saralin
chapter: Chapter 25: The Road to the Spear
info: [Lewin](#Lewin)'s and [Maigran](#Maigran)'s mother.

name: Scratch
info: Cat native to the Winespring Inn in Emond's Field. She is usually found asleep atop a shelf.

name: Sealdre
chapter: Chapter 25: The Road to the Spear
info: Wife of [Mandein](#Mandein). She has long, golden hair.

name: Seana
info: Aiel Wise One of the Black Cliff sept of the Nakai Aiel. She is a Dreamwalker, and one of [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere)'s teachers.

name: Sefela
info: One of the Aiel. [Aviendha](#Aviendha) suggests her as a person to escort [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) to Cold Rocks Hold.

name: Selene
info: A woman [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) meets in the alternate universe he reached via Portal Stone by accident. He thought she was the most beautiful woman he ever met. Selene was actually just an identity that [Lanfear](#Lanfear) assumed to guide Rand; she did not want to reveal her true identity to him before she established his trust.

name: Selindrin
info: Proprietress at the Garden of the Silver Breezes, an inn in Tanchico where [Captain Egeanin](#Captain-Egeanin) stays. She has dark hair done in dozens of narrow braids.

name: Semirhage
info: One of the Forsaken.

name: Sereine dar Shamelle Motara
info: Counsel-Sister to [Comaelle](#Queen-Comaelle), High Queen of Jaramide. She wrote _Commentaries on the Karaethon Cycle_ c. 325 AB, in the Third Age.

name: Sevanna
chapter: Chapter 48: An Offer RefusedChapter 49: Cold Rocks Hold
info: Widow of [Suladric](#Suladric). She will bring the Shaido to Alcair Dal, since they have no chief.

name: Shai'tan
info: The Dark One, source of all evil, complete opposite of the [Creator](#The-Creator) in every way. At the moment of Creation, the Dark One was imprisoned by the Creator at Shayol Ghul. This prison kept the Dark One from touching the world until it was bored into by humans during the Age of Legends. This hole, called the Bore, allowed the Dark One to once again touch the world, causing new outbreaks of war, treachery, violence, and crime. The attempt to free the Dark One completely resulted in the War of the Shadow (called the War of Power by some), during which a number of important leaders forsook the Light and gave their lives to the Dark One; these people are known today as the Forsaken, and were 13 of the most powerful Aes Sedai of the Age of Legends. The War of the Shadow did not end until [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon), the [Dragon](#The-Dragon), and his Hundred Companions Traveled to Shayol Ghul and re-sealed the Dark One back into his prison. At the moment of sealing, Shai'tan lashed out at those sealing the prison, driving them insane and tainting _saidin_ itself, the male half of the True Source, dooming all male Aes Sedai to insanity as well and starting the Time of Madness. These seals are weakening now, enough that the Forsaken have escaped and the Dark One is once again able to exert influence on the world.

name: Shaiel
chapter: Chapter 34: He Who Comes With The Dawn
info: [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s actual mother. She chose the name herself, never giving another to the Aiel who met her. It means, “Woman who is Dedicated.” She abandoned a son she loved and a husband she did not because [Gitara Moroso](#Gitara-Moroso) told her disaster would strike if she did not become a Maiden of the Spear. After a year she was adopted into the Jumai sept of the Taardad Aiel. Shaiel became pregnant during the Aiel War, and gave birth to a son, after which she died.

name: Shemerin
chapter: Chapter 47: The Truth of a Viewing
info: Aes Sedai of the Yellow Ajah. She is one of [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan)'s supporters, one of the sisters who arrested [Siuan](#Siuan-Sanche).

name: Shepherd of the Night
info: Alternative name for the Dark One.

name: Sheriam Bayanar
info: [Mistress of Novices](#Mistress-of-Novices) in the White Tower; an Aes Sedai of the Blue Ajah. [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw) has a viewing of her indicating that she will be hurt sometime in the future (although she cannot say when). Sheriam has long been a symbol of the Tower, at least in the eyes of those who come to study there—she keeps a strict but not brutal discipline and makes sure that her students know their place around her. Her study is famous in the Tower, both as a place of sanctuary when the stress of novice (or Accepted) life becomes too great to bear alone and as a place of punishment when an initiate steps out of line.

name: Siedre
info: Wife of [Adan](#Adan). She was killed along with [Marind](#Marind).

name: Sightblinder
info: Alternative name for the Dark One.

name: Siuan Sanche
info: Watcher of the Seals, the Flame of Tar Valon, the [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat). Born to a fisherman in Tear, she was sent to Tar Valon aboard the first boat to sail the morning she learned she could channel the One Power, in accordance with Tairen law. She has eyes that make even the most powerful ruler cower and try to please her just so she looks away. She is the youngest Amyrlin ever raised; she was only thirty years old when she assumed the Seat. She and [Moiraine Damodred](#Moiraine-Damodred) were good friends as Novices and Accepted, but walked away from each other after being raised to the shawl. Siuan fears she is nearly alone in the Tower, not knowing who to trust, who might be a Darkfriend. As such, she enlisted three Accepted with a mission: to track down members of the Black Ajah and do what she could trust no sister to do.

name: Slayer
chapter: Chapter 28: To the Tower of Ghenjei
info: Man that [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara) chases through _Tel'aran'rhiod_ all the way to the Tower of Ghenjei. He is there in the flesh, and can kill.

name: Soferra
info: Ogier, mother of [Ala](#Ala), grandmother of [Damelle](#Damelle).

name: Solinda
info: Aes Sedai who [Jonai](#Jonai) hopes will believe him when he says that he tried to do what they asked. She has sun-red hair. She is the one who made Jonai promise to keep the Way of the Leaf—he was shocked that she would even _suggest_ giving it up.

name: Someshta
info: A Nym who is present at the meeting of the Aes Sedai over the Dragon Banner and _Callandor_ in [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s seventh step through the columns of Rhuidean. The Nym are a race of people that grow things wherever they touch. Someshta is the last of the Nym, and the Aes Sedai asked him to watch over the Eye of the World for them until the Eye is used for its intended purpose (which was done when Rand drew on the pool of _saidin_ and killed two Forsaken).

name: Soran Milo
info: Author of _Killers of the Black Veil_. In one part he describes the Portal Stone near Rhuidean, as told him by a peddler.

name: Sorelle
info: [Adan](#Adan)'s daughter. She died at age twenty of a fever that her dreams warned her was coming.

name: Soulsbane
info: Alternative name for the Dark One.

name: Stepper
info: [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara)'s horse.

name: Suladric
info: Late chief of the Shaido Aiel. [Muradin](#Muradin) was sent to Rhuidean to replace him as clan chief. He was married to [Sevanna](#Sevanna).

name: Sulamein so Bhagad
info: Author of _The Wheel of Time_, an old history book, and the Chief Historian at the Court of the Sun in Cairhien in the Fourth Age.

name: Sulwin
info: The leader of the group of Aiel who demanded that [Adan](#Adan) do something about their wagon burdens, etc. that they were charged with keeping safe. He and some other of his group grew their hair long in hope of disguising the fact that they were Aiel. The group eventually decides that they want to go their own way, effectively separating from the Aiel—the Aiel deemed them “Lost.” These “Lost Ones” are now known as the Tuatha'an, the Traveling People. They still follow the Way of the Leaf, just as the Aiel once did.

name: Surela
info: Seanchan woman to whom [Alwhin](#Alwhin) sends [Taisa](#Taisa) as a punishment for failure to control her _damane_, [Pura](#Pura).

name: Surine
info: A _sul'dam_ that [Captain Egeanin](#Captain-Egeanin) is looking for. She looks like [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara), but is about a head taller.

name: Swallow
info: [Faile](#Faile-Bashere)'s horse. He is black with thin ankles and an arched neck.

name: Tad Barran
info: A stablehand at the Winespring Inn in Emond's Field.

name: Taisa
info: A _sul'dam_. She is the one in control of [Pura](#Pura) when she is brought before the [Empress](#The-Empress-of-Seanchan-) for questioning.

name: Tamlin (Tam) al'Thor
info: [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s father. He taught Rand about the Flame and the Void, a trick he uses to concentrate and to win archery competitions; Rand found that it is the way he can gain access to _saidin_. Tam is not actually Rand's biological father; he found Rand as a newborn on the slopes of Dragonmount and took him home with him since Rand's mother was dead. He was at Dragonmount as part of the Aiel War, which he left home to participate in when he was young. He became an officer in the Illianer army, and even achieved Blademaster status, acquiring a heron-mark sword. He married a woman from Caemlyn, [Kari](#Kari-al-Thor), whom he met while stationed there. When the Aiel War started, he fought Aiel all the way to Tar Valon and the Battle of the Shining Walls, where he found Rand on the mountain. Tam and Kari raised Rand as their own son. Tam always won the archery competitions (or came in second to [Abell Cauthon](#Abell-Cauthon)), and passed his archery skills on to Rand. Tam never knew that the child he was raising was the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn).

name: Tamrin
info: Head of [King Andric](#Andric)'s armies in Tanchico. [Carridin](#Jaichim-Carridin) thinks he should sweep the beggars from the city and let the rebels deal with them in the countryside.

name: Tarwin
info: Hero of old and subject of many songs and tales. He has a pass, Tarwin's Gap, named after him between Shienar and what was once Malkier.

name: Tell Lewin
chapter: Chapter 33: A New Weave in the Pattern
info: [Flann](#Flann-Lewin)'s nephew, and [Dannil](#Dannil-Lewin)'s cousin. He and Dannil look so much like Flann that they could be sons (or even clones) instead of nephews.

name: Temaile Kinderode
info: Aes Sedai of the Black Ajah, formerly of the Gray. A fragile woman from Cairhien with very big, blue eyes. [Amico](#Amico-Nagoyin) allegedly overheard her talking with [Liandrin](#Liandrin) about Black Ajah business. She has a mean streak a mile wide—she actually _enjoys_ the pain of others.

name: Teven Marwin
info: One of [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara)'s recruits. He was killed by the Trollocs when they attacked the patrol from behind.

name: The Creator
info: The creator of the Universe, people, places, things, the True Source, everything in existence. An alternate name would be God. After He created the world, the Creator made a prison for [Shai'tan](#Dark-One), the Dark One, his complete opposite in every way, to keep him from influencing the world. The Creator is bent on non-interference—He will not directly influence events in the world, instead using a “Chosen One” or tugging at the Pattern of the Age in hopes that what He wants to occur will occur, instead of just making it happen.

name: The Dragon
info: Name by which [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon) was known during the War of the Shadow. His rebirth, the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn), is now alive and fulfilling all of the prophecies set to accompany him.

name: The Empress (of Seanchan)
info: Ruler of Seanchan. She is considered to be a direct descendant of the first Emperor of Seanchan, [Luthair Paendrag Mondwhin](#Luthair-Paendrag-Mondwhin).

name: The Prophet
info: Man who stirs up riots in Ghealdan by preaching of the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn).

name: Thera
info: Name [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) gives to [Rendra](#Rendra) for [Amathera](#Amathera-Aelfdene-Casmir-Lounault), the Panarch. She uses it as a disguise, a refugee with no money and no place to stay. Elayne thinks that a little time in poverty will do Amathera some good—she will realize what the lower classes are feeling.

name: Thomdril (Thom) Merrilin
info: A gleeman who came to Emond's Field on Winternight when the Trollocs came. [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara) thinks him to be quite the ladies' man, which is fairly accurate. Thom is good at juggling, sleight-of-hand, and all kinds of other tricks. He also carries several concealed knives up his sleeves, in his boots, and in various other locations on his body; this practice seems to have spread from Thom to [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) and [Faile](#Faile-Bashere). Thom was originally a bard in [Queen Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand)'s Royal Court, and for a time after her husband [Taringail Damodred](#Lord-Taringail-Damodred) died, he was the Queen's lover. During his fight with a Fade near Shadar Logoth, he was injured, and now walks with a limp because of it. Thom is getting old, such that he is starting to realize that he cannot do the backflips and other stunts he used to do.

name: Tiam of Gazar
info: Person who proposed the Gazaran Calendar, which celebrated the alleged freedom from the Trolloc threat by recording Free Years (FY). This calendar was adopted due to the chaos the resulted during the Trolloc Wars and the resulting confusion as to which year it actually was under the Toman Calendar.

name: Tim
info: Young man from Emond's Field who died in the Trolloc attack.

name: Toma dur Ahmid
info: Person who devised the Toman Calendar, which was adopted approximately two hundred years after the death of the last male Aes Sedai and continued until the Trolloc Wars. The Calendar recorded years After the Breaking, or AB.

name: Toma
info: Man who strikes [Coumin](#Coumin) on the way to the city. He believed that Coumin was a Darkfriend because his father, [Charn](#Charn), claimed to have served [Lanfear](#Lanfear) (before she was called Lanfear).

name: Tomada
info: Ogier present at the seedsinging during [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s eighth step through the columns of Rhuidean. He asked the soldier what the news was, and he told him that [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon) and the Hundred Companions had resealed the [Dark One](#Dark-One)'s prison with the Forsaken inside.

name: Tomas
info: A Warder, bonded to [Verin](#Verin-Mathwin). He stops [Marin](#Marin-al-Vere), [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara), etc. enroute to the old sickhouse.

name: Toram
info: [Coine](#Coine-din-Jubai-Wild-Winds)'s husband. He is Cargomaster on _Wavedancer_.

name: Torean Andiama
info: High Lord of Tear on guard outside [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s chamber in the Stone of Tear. He has white hair streaking his black beard. Right after Rand received his injury from the “bubble of evil,” he was having an argument with Torean, after which Rand picked up Torean and flung him out of the room. He is the wealthiest of the High Lords of Tear. Later, Rand charges Torean with financing his war campaign, since Torean has all the funding for it.

name: Tuck Padwhin
info: Citizen of Emond's Field.

name: Uno Nomesta
chapter: Chapter 33: A New Weave in the Pattern
info: Shienaran soldier with an extremely foul tongue. He accompanied the three boys from Emond's Field on their journey from Fal Dara. [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara) tries to say what Uno would say to his men when he is trying to keep his own soldiers in line.

name: Uren din Jubai Soaring Gull
info: Sea Folk scholar and deviser of the [Farede](#Panarch-Farede) Calendar, which measured dates from the arbitrarily set end of the War of the Hundred Years as years of the New Era (NE). This calendar is currently in use.

name: Vanora Carridin
info: [Jaichim Carridin](#Jaichim-Carridin)'s sister. He describes where she is to [Liandrin](#Liandrin) when she comes to ask his progress, thinking that she was there to kill him.

name: Verin Mathwin
info: Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah. She accompanied [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere), [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara), [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand), and [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) back to the Tower from Falme. Unlike most Browns, Verin seems to be actively involved in the world outside the Tower library, and is much less disconnected than most of her Brown cohorts. She garners a small measure of trust from [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche), the [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat), who feels she has no choice but to trust Verin given what she knows: she is one of only two Aes Sedai (the others being Siuan herself and [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred)) that knew the truth that [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor) was the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn) before he fought in the sky above Falme and declared himself in the Stone of Tear.

name: Wil al'Seen
info: A cousin of [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara)'s from Deven Ride.

name: Willim
info: A man from [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s sixth step through the columns of Rhuidean who was sent away from the Aiel clan because he found he could channel _saidin_. He was [Jonai](#Jonai)'s son.

name: Win Lewin
info: Lanky boy that runs in to announce [Lord Luc](#Lord-Luc-Chiendelna)'s arrival at the al'Seen farm. [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara) is not certain of his identity, however; boys grow quickly at his age.

name: Wit Congar
info: Citizen of Emond's Field. [Bran](#Brandelwyn-Bran-al-Vere) believes that he would tell tales to the Whitecloaks about [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara) if they started asking.

name: Wit al'Seen
info: [Jac al'Seen](#Jac-al-Seen)'s cousin. Jac took his family in because Wit's farm was too close to the Westwood, and thus likely to be attacked by Trollocs.

name: Young Bull
chapter: Chapter 28: To the Tower of Ghenjei
info: What the wolves call [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara).

name: Yurian Stonebow
info: False [Dragon](#The-Dragon) who declared himself circa 1300 AB and was captured and gentled circa 1308 AB. He had great potential with the One Power.

name: Zarine Bashere
chapter: Chapter 53: The Price of a Departure
info: [Faile](#Faile-Bashere)'s real name. She despises it. According to [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred), only a mother who expected her daughter to be extremely beautiful would name her Zarine.

name: Zorelle
info: Aes Sedai that [Nalla](#Nalla) serves in [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s ninth step through the columns of Rhuidean. [Charn](#Charn) would serve her as well if he married Nalla.

name: al'Lan Mandragoran
info: The uncrowned king of Malkier, and Warder to [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred). He is quite tall, and does not get very emotional—in fact, he has what Moiraine describes as “emotional walls” that he has been building for years. His country, Malkier, was overrun by Trollocs shortly after he was born, and is now corrupted by the Great Blight. Lan, the last of his people, then proceeded to fight a one-man war against the Shadow by killing Shadowspawn in the Blight. He fought Aiel during the Aiel War, and achieved Blademaster status. He was eventually bonded by Moiraine, which ended his lonely fight (or at least changed its style). When Lan and Moiraine brought [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor), [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara), [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere), and [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) out of their home in the Two Rivers, he found that there was something which could throw his guard down, but he was the last to notice it: affection for Nynaeve. As Moiraine put it, Nynaeve was able to plant vines in Lan's emotional walls and break them down without him even knowing they were there. He loves her very much, whether he admits it openly or not, and Nynaeve, to her surprise (and Lan's), loves him in return. His favorite colors on women are green, blue, and white—Nynaeve's wardrobe just happened to become rich in those colors once she found out.
